title: Listed as pencils ...pencils arrived
review: Well what really can you say about a box of pencils that have been put away ready for September.... my eldest nephew is moving up to secondary school... boo hoo ...however back to the pencils well they arrived within a day or two of ordering. They were in a ziplock bag not a standard pencil box (which not massive deal as obviously cuts postage & costs down for company and purchasers. For those complaining look on the bright side they could of been loose)Once again back to the actual pencils.....they were  Staedtler Noris school yellow ,black striped hb pencils! All 50 were accounted for and all sharp!Now as for them doing as should I can only comment on the 2 I tested and the 5 I have already borrowed, they worked well and wrote what I told them to, but I guess they could of made my handwriting a little neater but at this price I can't complain!!!Now I'll have to come back at a later date to update you on how well the pencils sharpened and how often they needed to be sharpened! Will also update any news on the performance of the rest of the set!!

title: Serh gute Bleistifte
review: Schon die alten √Ñgypter nutzten Blei, um wichtige und weniger wichtige Informationen festzuhalten. Und das vor √ºber 5.000 Jahren.Bis zum heutigen Bleistift war es freilich ein weiter Weg und ich f√ºrchte, dass keine weltbewegenden Dokumente mit ihnen unterzeichnet, wohl aber wom√∂glich konzipiert wurden.Heute sind Bleistifte in den meisten Haushalten zu finden und ganz sicher findet man sie im M√§ppchen von Sch√ºlern aller Altersstufen.Die hier vorliegenden Evolution-Bleistifte von BIC kommen g√§nzlich ohne Holz aus. Sie sind sechseckig,  bestehen aus Kunstharz, sind komplett durchgef√§rbt und kommen in der St√§rke HB daher.In einer Blister-Verpackung ruhen vier St√ºck; braucht man sie nicht alle, muss man sich also einen guten Aufbewahrungsort ausdenken.Dank ihrer Form liegen sie gut in der Hand. Auch Kinder ‚Äì Testobjekt war hier meine siebenj√§hrige Enkelin ‚Äì konnte gut damit malen und schreiben.Anfangs hatte ich aufgrund von Material und Form ein wenig Angst, die Stifte k√∂nnten sich nicht gut spitzen lassen.  Aber diese Angst war unbegr√ºndet - in einem normalen Spitzer lassen sich die Spitzer m√ºhelos spitzen.Hat man die Kinder , dann wei√ü man eines - sie lassen die Stifte fallen, und schon brechen die Minen. Dies ist hier anders, wie ein Bruchtest ergab. Auch mehrfaches Hinunterwerfen lie√ü die Minen nicht splittern.Fazit: Farbenfroh, gut zu handhaben und stabil ‚Äì besser geht es nicht! Diese Bleistifte geh√∂ren in jedes M√§ppchen, machen aber aufgrund ihrer Optik auch in B√ºros einen guten Eindruck.

So muss im Vergleich mit Bleistiften anderer Hersteller fest aufgedr√ºckt werden, um ‚ÄûFarbe‚Äú auf das Papier zu bekommen. Besonders auf glatterem Papier wie bei Schulb√ºchern f√§llt dies auf. prod_name: Faber-Castell TK-Fine-9760 Mechanical Pencils Wallet of 3 - 0.35, 0.5, 0.7mm, Green
title: Great Faber-Castell leads once one of the mechanical issue was sorted out.
review: Pack of three Mechanical pencils. The 0.7 and 0.5 work fine. The 0.35 was problematic. The lead (graphite) inside constantly broke when pressing the top to reveal more of the 0.35 lead, and it intermittently slipped back into the barrel of the pencil when you finally get the lead to emerge and put it to paper. I Had to remove bits of the broken lead (and the other two leads inside the pencil), make sure no small lengths left inside, then very carefully insert a single 0.35 lead and started again. This problem seems to be solved - so far - now that there is only one 0.35 lead in the pencil. This is a mechanical issue, not the leads in the pencils. These are excellent and produce smooth and consistent marks on the paper used. In conclusion: Initial disappointment from usual excellent Faber-Castell products but will monitor and report back.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 26 April 2021

prod_name: STAEDTLER 100B G6 Mars Lumograph Pencils, Black, Pack of 6
title: Exceptional Quality for Sketching Enthusiasts
review: The Lumograph STAEDTLER Graphite Sketch Pencil is a true gem for anyone passionate about sketching or drawing. I've been using these pencils for a while now, and they consistently deliver outstanding results.First and foremost, the quality of the graphite is exceptional. The lead is smooth, allowing for effortless strokes and precise lines. Whether I'm working on intricate details or shading larger areas, these pencils provide the control and versatility I need.The range of hardness available in the set is perfect for various sketching techniques. From the soft and buttery feel of the 8B for darker shades to the crisp lines achievable with the 2H, these pencils cover the spectrum beautifully. The consistent quality across the entire range ensures a seamless transition between different hardness levels.The pencil's minimalistic design and the vibrant blue hue make it visually appealing, which is an added bonus for those who appreciate aesthetics in their art tools.In conclusion, the Lumograph STAEDTLER Graphite Sketch Pencil is a top-tier choice for sketching enthusiasts. The quality, range, and durability make them a staple in my sketching toolkit. If you're serious about your art and demand the best from your pencils, these are an absolute must-try. Five stars without a doubt!

title: Staedtler Mars Lumograph Black: finalmente ombre nere e opache !
review: Ho acquistato queste matite Mars Lumograph Black perch√© ero rimasto molto contento della grafite 8B della stessa marca, contenuta nell'ottimo set da 12 Mars Lumograph "normali", anch'esso in vendita su Amazon.In effetti, questa grafite Mars Lumograph 8B √® particolarissima. Molto nera e quasi "grassa", √® poco cancellabile come se fosse una matita colorata ed in breve √® diventata la mia preferita (allego la palette dell'intero set, a lato di un piccolo bozzetto che feci tempo fa per esemplificare l'uso delle varie gradazioni di grafite).√à allora che sono venuto a conoscenza di questo nuovo tipo di matite della Staedtler, sempre Mars Lumograph ma di tipo "Black", anch'esse in grafite ma di colore molto pi√π nero del normale per la presenza di una pi√π alta percentuale di carbone; vedendole in vendita qui su Amazon, le ho acquistate per curiosit√†.Fatta esclusione per la 8B del set Mars Lumograph "normale" che √® del tutto simile con la 8B di tipo "Black", le altre gradazioni non sono da confondere per√≤, in quanto a resa grafica, n√© con quelle in normale grafite n√© con le matite a carboncino.Delle prime non hanno quei fastidiosi riflessi lucidi avendo una finitura opaca, e delle seconde non possiedono la friabilit√† propria del carbone.Sono pastose e poco cancellabili come se fossero delle matite colorate nere, ma a differenza di queste sono sfumabili anche con le dita, hanno una mina resistentissima e molto affilabile, e soprattutto sono di quattro gradazioni diverse: la confezione comprende due matite di gradazione 2B, due 4B, una 6B e una 8B.Io le uso spesso e con piacere perch√© queste matite Black consentono agli amanti di questo tipo di tecnica, semplicemente ripassando un sottile strato sulle zone fatte con la grafite normale dove si vuole che sia reso un nero pi√π profondo, di attenuare anche l'effetto lucido tipico della grafite.Queste Mars Lumograph Black sono un complemento anche per chi ama disegnare con il carboncino: le rifiniture, i particolari e le ombre pi√π scure possono essere aggiunte con profitto dopo la stesura del fissatore ottenendo risultati molto convincenti.Allego tra le immagini il confronto tra la matita Lumograph in normale grafite di gradazione 8B e la sua "gemella" 8B Lumograph Black: entrambe hanno la mina di diametro maggiore delle altre gradazioni: ben 4,5 mm., mentre per le Black 6B, 4B e 2B il diametro √® di 3,6.Le Mars Lumograph Black sono contenute in una pratica scatola metallica con una funzionale cerniera apribile (molto comoda per coloro che disegnano sovente anche all'aperto o in altre svariate condizioni ambientali), ed inoltre, al di l√† dell'abituale eleganza, riportano intelligentemente su ognuna delle sei facce la gradazione (caratteristica comodissima per un disegnatore).Consiglio a tutti gli appassionati di disegno, professionisti e non, l'acquisto delle Lumograph black, perch√© la resa √® in definitiva qualcosa di diverso: diverso dalle grafiti, diverso dai carboncini, diverso dalle matite colorate. Si ha un ibrido di cui davvero si sentiva la mancanza a livello grafico.P.S.:Ora che sto scrivendo noto che ne hanno prodotto un kit in cui le matite Lumograph Black sono tutte di gradazioni diverse, avendo aggiunto la HB e la 7B: le acquister√≤ non appena "nanizzate" queste.Spero di esservi stato utile.

title: Great art pencils
review: The original Staedtler Lumograph 7B (EB) was always my favorite but the 7B & 8B (EE) never quite fit in with the rest of the Lumograph drawing pencils, they were a carbon & graphite mix while the rest of the grades are graphite. Having them split into two lines gives so much more options. They are nice & dark, as dark as Cretacolor Neros & darker than Faber Castell Matte but not as smooth as either, you can feel just a bit of grab on the paper. You can erase but minimally & smudging/blending with stumps or tortillons is also minimal but that helps make sketchbook drawings stay less messy. This is a great & useful addition to any drawing toolkit.

prod_name: STAEDTLER 100B G6 Mars Lumograph Pencils, Black, Pack of 6
title: Really dark and no shine
review: These pencils are exceptional. They are very black, not grey and leave no graphite shine.I do not use these for skin or shading because they don't blend out well. This isn't necessarily a bad thing. There are parts you don't want to smudge,  like eyelashes.I use caran d'ache grafwood for my skin as they are very soft and blend out well. Not great for detail though. Then I use Faber-Castell pitt matte pencils for most other parts of a drawing.Using all 3 brands enables me to get the best of them all.

prod_name: STAEDTLER 100B G6 Mars Lumograph Pencils, Black, Pack of 6
title: Paying a little more is worth it
review: Amazon carries plenty of no-name and budget brand pencil sets, cheap, and they are usually fine. I have bought several without regret. But spending just a few dollars more for a box of Staedtlers is worth it. I do think they sharpen better with less lead breakage and last longer, but that could be me just getting better at sharpening (yes, there is a knack to it). The nicest touch is how the hardness value is imprinted on all six faces of the hexagon, so you can locate the one you want without having to rotate pencils to see the label. I don't know of any other pencil brand that has this. Remember that there are two different 12-packs--this one, which is mostly softer leads, and another that emphasizes the harder ones. Amazon can be overpriced for some art supplies, but not here--this is a very good price for this product compared to art stores and other online sellers. I might stock up!

title: Mejores cuanto m√°s los usas
review: He usado todo tipo de l√°pices 'negros' para los tonos oscuros, desde grafitos de distintas marcas, pasando por carbones normales, comprimidos, grasos, los Cont√© 1720, pasteles negros ... Bien por vaguer√≠a o porque soy demasiado principiante para darme cuenta, voy buscando un tipo de l√°piz que me permita negros intensos, pero que luego no tenga que andar con fijadores para que no se me vaya o se traspase a la hoja de al lado. Los Cont√© igual se acercaban un poco pero siguen manchando all√° por donde pasan.Estos cayeron en mis manos despu√©s de ver varios an√°lisis. Al principio me resultaba algo extra√±a la sensaci√≥n, ya que no son suaves como un grafito, son como una cera dura, pero los resultados me gustaron mucho. Alcanzan negros mucho m√°s intensos que un grafito (aunque el Steadtler normal 8B no est√° nada mal) y no tienes ese brillo del grafito que puede ser molesto. A medida que los usas y te acostumbras vas obteniendo mejores resultados y te van gustando m√°s. Se quedan bastante bien en el papel, no difuminan mal, no manchan ni necesitan de fijador. La cajita donde vienen en un buen detalle y el precio por 6 l√°pices est√° muy bien.Un excelente producto que va a gustar a los amantes del dibujo a l√°piz.

prod_name: STAEDTLER 100B G6 Mars Lumograph Pencils, Black, Pack of 6
title: Iconic pencil
review: These are excellent premium quality pencils by Staedtler for sketching. There are 12 x 8mm pencils in total ranging from 2H to 8B. The degrees of softness are: 2H, H, F, HB, B, 2B, 3B, 4B, 5B, 6B, 7B, 8B. They are presented in a nice metal tin which provides good protection and easy access. The highly distinctive blue, silver and black top livery is iconic and it hasn't changed in years.I have used these pencils before and they have never let me down. This set is excellent for building up tone in portrait or landscape sketches for example. They sharpen well without splintering, and are comfortable to hold and use. The graphite is super smooth on paper and does not scratch at all like cheaper pencils. The graphite also erases easily so you can perfect your work. There is something very nice and satisfying about a good quality pencil like this one. This is a great set for any artist or student alike. Recommended.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 January 2015

prod_name: STAEDTLER 100B G6 Mars Lumograph Pencils, Black, Pack of 6
title: ‚ÄúThese are real artist grade pencils.‚Äù
review: I hope I‚Äôm not the only one that wanted to see a comparison between these and the Faber Pitt-Matte set. I would first like to say I‚Äôm a fan of both brands but neither is my all time favorite brand, so I sway neither direction in a biased opinion.  So let‚Äôs begin. After a scale hardness check, these pencils were exactly on scale where they are claiming to be. Paint on these pencils are very nice. While holding them, they feel exactly like the regular Lumos. And after a few hours of testing these, I will admit that these are better than the regular Lumograph set, and they are slightly above the faber-9000 series, however, they fall short of being as good as the faber Pitt-Matte set.  Why?  Well they just don‚Äôt have that matte charcoal finish that the Pitt set is able to achieve. I have also did a review on that set if you happen to stumble across it here on Amazon.  Listen, don‚Äôt get me wrong, these pencils are definitely in a serious race here. And could possibly be in the top 5th or 6th place of the best woodcase pencils being made. And I don‚Äôt have to tell you there are thousands of wood case pencil companies. Hundreds of them claiming to be the best artist grade pencils.  If you can make it into the top 10 on my list, your pencils are definitely worth buying. And these Lumo Blacks are definitely on my list. These are the types of pencils that make you want to draw. I know you are not bound down to artistic creativity by tools, however, any artist will tell you, you can only get as good as the tool will let you.  So when you by cheap supplies, your progress will only go so far before you must upgrade to better supplies or your abilities will fall short of your capable talents.  ...A set like this will not only help you achieve better work, but will also make you strive to push them and yourself to higher levels of progression. I definitely suggest buying this set and testing them out for yourself. Or if you are also a collector like myself, add this set into your collection. I always buy 2 sets of every pencil so I will always have a brand new set to put into my massive pencil collection. I hope this review helps out
date: Reviewed in the United States on 15 January 2023

prod_name: Mechanical pencil Pentel PG1013-E GraphGear1000, line width 0.3 mm, rubber (Z2-1N), 1 piece
title: Quality mechanical pencil
review: I‚Äôve been using the 0.7 model for many years. Totally my go-to writing tool. It‚Äôs so-well made, easy to write with, well balanced in the hand etc. I like that there‚Äôs the option to set a visual at the top that reminds you what grade of lead you are using. I always use Pentel Ain Stein refills, and always 2B, but that‚Äôs not a fact I hold in my head every day, so when I go to order refills the ‚Äú2B‚Äù reference is useful.This is my go-to tool for writing notes at work. And has been for years.What I don‚Äôt like - it‚Äôs quite long, even after clicking the button to retract the nib. Having said that, it still fits in any case or bag that in which I transport it.Other things - give it good quality lead. It works brilliantly with Pentel Ain Stein leads. They‚Äôre smooth when laying down text (I don‚Äôt have any experience of drawing with this tool)When I first got it I used whatever 0.7 leads I had to hand, and it was awful. The above Pentel leads are now available a lot cheaper - and are significantly better.Hope that helps in your purchasing decision. I have amassed quite a ‚Äòcollection‚Äô of mechanical pencils including Rotring etc, but this one is totally the best. Not just slightly better- a lot better. My ‚Äòcollection‚Äô isn‚Äôt really a planned collection- it‚Äôs stuff I‚Äôve bought over the years on the journey to find a really decent mechanical pencil.Pentel Ain Stein Leads are equally key, in any pencil. Very smooth.

title: Fantastic pencil
review: This pencil has been my daily driver ever since I‚Äôve bought it, so I feel I‚Äôm qualified to give a thorough review.It‚Äôs a fantastic pencil. While I haven‚Äôt had the luxury of owning a Rotring or a super-high end pencil, I did use regular plastic mechanical pencils for years; the kind of cheap pencil that come in packs of 50. This pencil blows them out of the water, in every aspect except one (which I will get to).PROS:- well balanced, weight feels good when writing- the thing is a marvel of craftsmanship. Seriously, I‚Äôm still amazed at how much stuff they crammed into it- the extending barrel is convenient, doesn‚Äôt have much play- you can press down with a LOT of force before the lead recedes into the barrel- the grip is greatCONS- The eraser. As someone who has to erase mistakes constantly, the size of the eraser is laughable and didn‚Äôt last me two weeks. Luckily it comes with replacements, however they also don‚Äôt last long..-the end cap. I tried like hell not to lose it, but it‚Äôs just too easy to lose if you‚Äôre using the eraser

prod_name: Mechanical pencil Pentel PG1013-E GraphGear1000, line width 0.3 mm, rubber (Z2-1N), 1 piece
title: Pentel Graphgear 1000 (0,3 mm)
review: Die Rezension bezieht sich auf den Pentel Graphgear 1000 mit Minenst√§rke 0,3 mmGrundlegend positiv hervorzuheben ist die hohe Verarbeitungsqualit√§t: Das massive Metallgeh√§use macht einen ausgesprochen stabilen und wertigen Eindruck. Das Finish des Stiftes ist mattsilber, w√§hrend der Taschenclip und Teile des Druckmechanismus gl√§nzend gehalten sind. Die Griffzone ist mit einer sehr feinen, rautenf√∂rmigen Maserung auf dem Metall und Silikonnoppen versehen. Die Maserung wirkt nicht ausgefranst oder unpr√§zise gefr√§st - ganz im Gegenteil -, was den guten Eindruck bez√ºglich der allgemeinen Verarbeitungsqualit√§t best√§tigt. An der Griffzone ist zudem eine Vorrichtung angebracht, bei der durch Drehen die verwendete Minenst√§rke angezeigt werden kann. Teile des Innenlebens bestehen aus (massivem) Kunststoff.Sobald der Taschenclip gedr√ºckt wird, f√§hrt die Spitze des Bleistifts vollst√§ndig in das Geh√§use zur√ºck, was ebenfalls einen sehr positiven Eindruck hinterl√§sst - hierdurch wird einerseits Verhindert, dass Kleidung durch den Graphitstaub der Mine verschmutzt werden kann (beim Transport in der Hemdtasche z. B.) und andererseits wird die Spitze des Stiftes so beim Transport sicher vor Besch√§digungen gesch√ºtzt. Der Federmechanismus des Taschenclips ist auf jeden Fall stark genug, um ein versehentliches Ausl√∂sen der Transportsicherung zu verhindern.Unter der Kappe des Druckmechanismus ist ein Radiergummi angebracht. Dieser ist ca. 2 cm lang, kann also bei "Verbrauch" nach oben nachgeschoben werden (zum pr√§zisen Radieren gibt es nat√ºrlich auch Radierstifte - diese sind nicht teuer, ich habe mir gleich einen mitbestellt). Im Inneren des Stiftes ist am Ende des Radiergummis ein ca. 2 cm langer Metallstab in Minenst√§rke angebracht. Er dient dazu, ggf. abgebrochene Minenreste aus der Spitze des Stiftes zu entfernen, sehr n√ºtzlich.Wer mit g√ºnstigeren Druckbleistiften gearbeitet hat, kennt sicherlich das Problem, dass die Mine "zu weit" vorgeschoben wird - und gerade bei festerem Aufdr√ºcken oder der Verwendung d√ºnner Minen gerne abbricht. Bei diesem Stift ist das anders: Es wird genug der Mine vorgeschoben, um den Stift kontinuierlich benutzen zu k√∂nnen, aber nicht so viel, dass die Mine bei der Benutzung abbricht. F√ºr die intensive Arbeit auf jeden Fall sehr angenehm (zum Vergleich: Bei einem g√ºnstigeren Druckbleistift eines namhaften Herstellers wird bei einmaliger Bet√§tigung die Mine ca. 4x weiter vorgeschoben als beim Graphgear).F√ºr meinen Geschmack d√ºrfte der Stift etwas "kopflastiger" sein, die Gewichtsverteilung liegt - meiner Meinung nach - nicht weit genug vorne. Das f√§llt beim Gebrauch allerdings kaum auf. Im Gegensatz zu (Voll-)Kunststoffstiften ist der Graphgear 1000 (nat√ºrlich) merklich schwerer.Einziger Kritikpunkt ist der Reibwiderstand auf der Griffzone: Im Gegensatz zu gummierten Stiften (hier im Vergleich zum Rotring Tikky) muss mehr Kraft aufgewendet werden, um den Stift sicher zu f√ºhren, da er sich etwas "rutschig" anf√ºhlt. Das ist mit Sicherheit auch Gew√∂hnungssache, jedoch h√§tten die Silikonnoppen aus diesem Grund f√ºr meinen Geschmack etwas weiter aus dem Metall der Griffzone herausstehen d√ºrfen (sie schlie√üen gef√ºhlt fast b√ºndig mit der Metalloberfl√§che ab).Gerade wegen der guten Verarbeitungsqualit√§t und dem angenehmen Arbeiten (Stichwort: Vorschub der Mine) bleibt es dennoch bei der guten Bewertung.

prod_name: Mechanical pencil Pentel PG1013-E GraphGear1000, line width 0.3 mm, rubber (Z2-1N), 1 piece
title: Great feel. Great value. Great warrantee.
review: I've bought 3 of these so far on separate occasions (all the 0.9 mm yellow version).  One was a gift for my 10 yo son, who kept borrowing mine, and won't write with anything else now.I love how this pencil feels in my hand and while writing. It is very well engineered, nicely balanced, and has a smooth mechanism. The auto-retracting mechanism when you clip in on you pocket is a nice touch. All around great design. I've only purchased the yellow one (0.9mm, HB lead) because I planned on mostly using it for marking wood for my woodworking projects and so needed the stronger/thicker lead, but I find myself writing with it all the time. It's just that pleasant to use.I had a problem with one of them (it broke at the yellow plastic part), and I contacted the Pantel warranty department since it was well past the 30 day Amazon return. It took them a while to respond (7-10 days, I forget) so I was initially concerned, but they responded saying they would send a new one and a label for me to return the broken one. Which they did, no questions, no hassle. Top marks for their customer service. Very happy.There are two things that could be better:1) There is one plastic piece in an otherwise all metal product. It is a weak point, and in fact where one of my pencils broke. But the customer service/warranty department has been great, so I guess if they continue like that (it has a lifetime warranty!), I can't complain too much.2) The clip is just folded metal and could be a bit sharp on clothes. This is actually a pretty common construction for clips on pencils and pens alike, but for $20+ I was hoping for better. I carry one of them with me pretty much at all times, so I'm a bit concerned the clip eventually will cut into the cloth. So far it hasn't, so I my concern might not be justified. Time will tell and I will try to update in 6+ months either way.Also, one thing I wish they had communicated more clearly: In order to set the handy lead hardness indicator, first loosen the conical end piece part. The indicator part should then spin feely. Make your selection and tighten it back up. (Finger tight is sufficient.)I got all of mine on sale around $13-$16. At that price you really can't beat the value. Full price is $23+, which might seem pricey for a pencil, but if you don't lose it, it should last you a very long time. I think it's well worth it even at full price if you value an affordable, quality writing/drafting pencil. (If you're prone to losing pencils, though, then your experience might vary. :-) )I highly recommend this pencil. (And seeing as I've bought this on 3 occasions, it goes without saying that I'd buy it again.)

prod_name: Mechanical pencil Pentel PG1013-E GraphGear1000, line width 0.3 mm, rubber (Z2-1N), 1 piece
title: MORE great pencils from the makers of many of my favorites!
review: SUMMARY:  All in all, I find this gift set a wonderful combination of great pencils, spare leads and erasers presented in a very classy box.CONTEXT:  The P-200 series of Pentel pencils have been favorites of mine for over 40 years, introduced to me by my engineer father, I used them from college (80's) on through my business career for drawing, note taking and sketching, and I still have the .3, .5, .7 and .9mm sizes on my desk today.REVIEWS: When I saw this Pentel GraphGear1000 Premium Gift Set, I immediately went to YouTube and started watching video reviews. Most were favorable, so I decided to treat myself to an early Christmas gift. I'm VERY happy I did.FEATURES: If the P200 series are light, nimble, no frills, highly effective pencil companions, the GG1000 series are their full-featured, sophisticated siblings. GRIP:  Even more comfortable in my hands than the P200 series (though the weightier feel might not be for everyone), the combination of knurled metal sleeve and rubber ellipses make a firm grip comfortable. CLIP:  The clip is a combination of a) very well-designed way to clip the pencil to pocket or note-pad, and also b) when the back of the clip is pressed, it serves to retract the lead-sleeve back into the tip ... this is not a trivial point. RETRACTABLE LEAD SLEEVE: One of the few disappointing experiences I've ever had with a P-203 (.3mm) was when the slender lead sleeve became bent ... a small bit of damage that rendered it useless. Retracting the lead sleeve back into the point not only protects the sleeve from damage, but also protects the pockets into which we thrust our pencils. A great idea. PUSH BUTTON TOP/ERASER/SLEEVE CLEANER/LEAD MAGAZINE:  The push button cap at the top of the pencil a) extends and allows the retraction of the lead into the lead sleeve, b) hides the combination eraser and sleeve cleaning needle (stuck into the bottom of eraser), and c) covers the lead magazine (under the eraser).  LEAD TYPE WINDOW:  Above the knurled grip is a rotatable window that allows the user to display the lead type they're currently using.FINER POINTS:> I've heard that setting the lead-grade window requires a slight loosening of the grip, but I haven't tried that yet. The video I watched made perfect sense of this, so if/when it comes up, I'll update the review here.> Those who prefer a very light weight pencil might find these too heavy. I like the weight feel.> The Gift Box is done well enough I've been using consistently, replacing each pencil in the box after every use.

prod_name: Mechanical pencil Pentel PG1013-E GraphGear1000, line width 0.3 mm, rubber (Z2-1N), 1 piece
title: The best mechanical pencil you are likely to come across
review: In short: Fulfils all criteria to guarantee an excellent product experience.Looks: I have lost track of how many years I have had mine (best part of a decade now). They still look the business and are often asked about by my clients whilst I am using them. One was even stolen, so I suppose that makes them quite desirable.Construction: The retractable tip is just perfect. It has a slight springiness to it that not only cushions the writing/drawing experience, but also helps avoid lead breakages, although the modern hi-poly' refills are pretty good in their own right. Made principally of plastic and aluminium, it is light yet very robust. The combination of a knurled section and rubber grip is perfect - no readjustment or sweaty finger problems. There are no fancy gears that turn the lead around (as advertised by other products) neither have I ever thought to myself that I need one of those - one less unnecessary mechanism that can go wrong = minimalism = long-lasting = happy owner.Use: Always works well, very easy to carry around (very light). Solid enough construction to withstand severe punishment - mine has been submerged in water for ~3 days (flood while I was away) & dropped from a height of over 10m (~30ft) - accidentally dropped in the space between staircase - which obliterated the lead refills inside but the pen works just fine. If it was the cheaper plastics varieties of mechanical pencils then they would not have survived. I'm also sure that some of the more expensive varieties will not be able to boast this. Even if it did stop working, replacing them is not going to be too painful. As testament to how well these have worked, I now have 3 varieties of these that take different refill sizes, as well as a spare 0.5mm as my all-rounder when I have to jot down or explain anything on the go. The oldest one is pushing a decade in age and looks/works like new. [For the astute fans out there: yes, they did make minor changes in their construction over the years, but not to any detriment]Conclusion: I have never been let down, only pleasantly surprised. I would highly recommend this over any other product I have tried (including comparisons against other brands that are >4x more expensive). A fantastic product that offers excellent value and many years of great service. This product has never disappointed me and I'm certain that most will agree once they have had the pleasure of using it.

Su peso es muy adecuado para sostenerlo en la mano c√≥modamente, adem√°s que tiene un mecanismo que lo hace retr√°ctil escondiendo la punta cuando lo transportas por dos razones no te rompes las camisas con la punta y se protege est√° cuando hay ca√≠das del portaminas, la punta no se da√±a. Las gomas que tiene en la sujeci√≥n permite una buena y c√≥moda sujeci√≥n siempre y cuando no tengas crema en las manos o est√©n h√∫medas, en ese caso se vuelve muy resbaloso. En general es muy recomendable por su costo y su buen dise√±o y calidad.

prod_name: Mechanical pencil Pentel PG1013-E GraphGear1000, line width 0.3 mm, rubber (Z2-1N), 1 piece
title: The only pen for me!
review: This is my absolute favorite pencil as an artist, and the only one I've used for quite a few years. I got one in high school and used it for four years, until I was a college sophomore. It stood up to daily note taking and drawing for four years. In the end, the only flaw in this pencil is the plastic seam, since that is what broke. Still, four years is an exceptionally long time for one pencil to last, especially since it is the only one I used for those four years. I purchased a second one right after the first one broke, and that one is still in excellent condition a year later.This is an excellent pencil for any artist, but has been especially wonderful for me, as someone with bad joints. The grip is bigger than a standard mechanical pencil, so it isn't as painful to write for long periods of time, and the silicone ovals make it easy to keep your grip on it.Retracting the tip of the pencil with the clip is a unique feature of this pencil, and honestly a bit of a fun party trick. People are always surprised by it. I have never had problems with the clip wearing out or breaking, and since the tip is retractable, I haven't had it break or bend either.

prod_name: Mechanical pencil Pentel PG1013-E GraphGear1000, line width 0.3 mm, rubber (Z2-1N), 1 piece
title: By far my favorite mechanical pencil
review: I like this pencil so much, I purchased all 5 sizes this time: 0.3, 0.4, 0.5, 0.7, and 0.9.  My favorite lead is 2B.  It's softer and much darker than the standard HB. H=Hard. The lead range is 4H, 3H...to HB, B...3B, 4B.  When I'm checking construction sites, I use 0.9 to write erasable info on wood, walls, and other materials, wet or dry, regardless of temperatures. Not so with Sharpies and wax pencils. In the office, I use 0.5 and 0.7 for paperwork, blueprints, etc. The British all-time favorite is 0.4. I use the 0.3 for adding tiny details to building drawings and it matches my love for 0.38 gel-ink (ultra-fine) pens.GraphGear 1000s are great mechanical pencils. The only ones with fully retractable pencil points. I use Pentel Clicking erasers instead of the endcaps. It seems like too much work to stop writing, pull-off the endcap, erase, then put it back on. In half that time, I've grabbed an eraser and done.  I had the same problem with the 0.7 pencil breaking like a couple of other Amazon reviewers. That blue ring in the middle of the pencil is plastic, which I didn't know until I found my pencil broken. Easy fix though. I put the two pieces back together and taped it super tight with black electrical tape - the good stuff (3M Temflex). Temflex is very durable, stretches a little, resistant to both water and extreme temperatures. 4 weeks later, my pencil still works like new and looks good. I kind of like the black tape. It's one more way of knowing which pencils are mine. Electrical tape comes in many colors. I plan to tape my other pencils too. So far, my new replacement 0.7 is not needed.NOTE: The price of lead refills varies a lot across Amazon. Also, Pentel has two sources. Ain Pentel is from Japan. I'm guessing the other is from China. ROtring, Staedtler, and Mars are brands well-known by engineers, architects, and draftsmen.  Faber-Castell is well-known in the art world. Presently, I trying Mr. Pen because I really like their gel highlighters and lower prices. So far, no complaints. But I have both Ain Pentel and Pentel waiting in the wings. Also, I don't care about the little bar code sticker on all my pencils because my hands never touch it except during lead refilling. Buy the GraphGear 1000. It's pricey but worth it if you write with pencil a lot.

prod_name: Mechanical pencil Pentel PG1013-E GraphGear1000, line width 0.3 mm, rubber (Z2-1N), 1 piece
title: An Excellent Mechanical Pencil; but improvements theoretically possible
review: This is an excellent mechanical pencil.  It's one you buy to keep; not use and dispose of. Undergraduate students looked at it with awe and respect (just kidding there- let's not get carried away).  It's very functional, but not the overt display of opulence of products made by jewelers.It writes very well, and has good balance.  The grip has that knurled surface that prevents it from slipping around when, for example, your hands are wet or dirty.  The action advancing the pencil leads is flawless..  Pencil leads can break when too much lateral pressure is applied, but it requires more than most other mechanical pencils.  The process of refilling leads is good.  No problems there.I like the design of that spring-loaded clip.  You ever find yourself upside-down when you didn't expect it?  It stays put in your shirtpocket or when clipped to your shirt's collar.After ~3-5 years I noticed some corrosion on the barrel of one i purchased.  This occurred after repeated exposure to humidity from being on the bathroom counter near the shower.  You wouldn't have that problem with plastic.  Some of the graphics looked weathered due to wear.  Could the black graphics be etched into the barrel?  Who knows how much a pencil like this would cost, however.The only weakness is that the eraser inside it (underneath the cap) tends to slide back when pressure is applied.  This doesn't happen with the eraser from the factory, but after I installed refills.  The eraser holding bracket just didn't grip enough (anymore) after installing refill erasers.  And so the eraser didn't stay put;' making erasure difficult and frustrating.  I know it's my own fault, with big Trump-like hands.  After putting in a new eraser, I couldn't re-form that bracket exactly again.  I believe that some writers might never use that eraser, opting instead for a separate one.Overall, a great product for those who need better than just a cheap throwaway pencil.

prod_name: Derwent Graphic Soft Graphite Drawing Pencils, Ideal For Illustrating & Shading, Set Of 12, Professional Quality, 34215
title: Derwents are some of the best around
reviewer: Mz Nina, business consultant and aspiring artist
review: I looove this brand, also all their colored pencil lines.  I know everyone is Prismacolor crazy, but it is hype.  Derwents are just as good and I am a little partial to them simply they are the ones I learn to draw with even as a kid.  I remember my first Derwent kit that Dad bought me, 120 pencils and I was around 8 and we were livi9ng in Australia.I love the water color pencils, the graphite, the ink tense that you can actually draw on fabric with and it stays, and the color soft line.  I also have a few others, but those are my favorites.I would say there pencils are as good as any other including Prismacolor.Just make sure to get the right pencil sharpener no matter what you use.  Get a Derwent battery operated, which is still made or a Panasonic or a used HUNT-Boston, all of which are no longer made.  DO NOT GET X-ACTO, it chews your pencils up and constantly breaks the lead.INFO ON ELECTRIC PENCIL SHARPENERS:I am a color pencil artist, and you need to have either a Panasonic, "Hunt-Boston" pencil sharpener, otherwise your colored pencils are eaten.  NEVER BUY X-ACTO for colored pencils, X-ACTO will eat your pencils.  Until you can find a Panasonic or Hunt-Boston, or Hunt or Boston electric pencil sharpener, get this if you can find one, or the Derwent "BLACK" model as it had 2 holes, one for a longer tip and one for a shorter tip.  I have both.  I had bought the Derwent one as I have Derwent but also use Prismacolor and graphite.  Panasonic and Hunt Boston are NO LONGER MADE no matter WHAT anyone says.  I was lucky to buy a new PANASONIC electric pencil sharpener by trolling the net until I found on.  Bought a used Boston, model #18, used on eBay and paid waaaay too much.  It was pretty beaten up.Also, if you do buy used, get one in the best quality that you can and just pay the extra, I would say up to $35.  I personally would not spend more than that.  I paid $38 for my new Panasonic.Also, X-ACTO bought out "Hunt-Boston" and all new models are a 4 digit model number, the actual "Hunt-Boston" is only a 2 digit.  This issue is that X-ACTO still sells under the Hunt Boston name, and it is misleading as it now uses X-ACTO cutters, which do NOTHING but EAT your pencils.  I also do not like it when someone lies about what they are selling.I bought what I thought was a "HUNT" electric pencil sharpener, it came in a box that had the Hunt name and packaging, but when I opened it up it was a, you guessed right...  An X-ACTO!!  Said so right on the sharpener.Bought on line here at Amazon from Overstock.com, but I returned it and got a refund, including shipping as they were misleading.Hope this helps with those of you who are colored pencil artist.  Get a PANASONIC, HUNT-BOSTON or Derwent sharpener.Also, run a graphite pencil through your sharpener first thing every day and it will stay sharp longer since colored pencils are waxy and tend to build up on the cutters.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 18 February 2013

prod_name: Derwent Graphic Soft Graphite Drawing Pencils, Ideal For Illustrating & Shading, Set Of 12, Professional Quality, 34215
title: 9h softer than 8h, otherwise perfect pencils.
review: So I did swatches of all the pencils I received (bought 12 hard and 12 soft sets) and was surprised at how dark 9h looked. I then start a swatch with 8h and it was much lighter. I thought maybe I just pressed lighter on the 8h, I continued with the rest of the pencils, and everything was perfect. So I did more comparisons of 8h and 9h with drawing lines, different shading, etc, and 9h is definitely darker than 8h, but whatever, I at least now know what to expect from both those pencils, probably just a lull in quality assurance that day. So a star off for that, butt other than that, great pencils, will buy again for their great price and (hopefully more reliable) quality.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 17 December 2015

This is the first tin I have gotten that has a damaged pencil in see photo it doesn‚Äôt look like it ruined the core of the pencil thankfully. For some of the reviews that mention only getting them in a tin without a lid and just the bottom shrink wrapped(the only difference is the lid not being there it‚Äôs still only the bottom shrink wrapped even if you get a lid not sure why they do that.) I would blame Derwent for that more than Amazon as even retail stores like hobby lobby get tins like that.

prod_name: Derwent Graphic Soft Graphite Drawing Pencils, Ideal For Illustrating & Shading, Set Of 12, Professional Quality, 34215
title: Great Starter Range Pencils
review: I love the quality of these pencils. I am taking a drawing class for the first time this semester and the range these pencils give me is great. I've had my teacher tell several other students that their supplies weren't adequate but has always just focused on showing me how to use mine. I don't know too much about pencils but if you're looking for a great starter range I would recommend this set.The only down side I have for the pencils is that the case doesn't allow for easy viewing and the pencils fall out fairly easily. However, I didn't really consider the case a huge deal because it stores them perfectly in transit. I just think it would be nice if the pencils snapped in and had a label along the bottom (not on the pencil) to know which pencil you're grabbing (because the pencils will rotate in the case).
date: Reviewed in the United States on 4 November 2013

prod_name: Derwent Graphic Soft Graphite Drawing Pencils, Ideal For Illustrating & Shading, Set Of 12, Professional Quality, 34215
title: Great quality, great condition
review: This product only took a day to deliver. I also live in Canada, so that might be different for others. The graphite is pretty resistant to breaking, lays down graphite smoothly, and is pretty dark. It's not the darkest or smoothest I've drawn with, but it is super affordable. The overall quality of the pencils are still very good, artist quality. They're great for quick sketches, but excel in detailed sketches.

prod_name: Faber-Castell - Castell 9000 Art Set Pencil (Pack of 6), Green
title: I Don't Know How I Learned Without Them
review: I don't know why in the world I waited so long to buy some good drawing pencils! I have been sketching with whatever mechanical pencil I had in my bag for years with very little preference, but the way that my sketches have improved with these pencils has been dramatic! Now I feel comfortable creating full pieces of art in shades of grey, whereas before I would sketch lightly and then use other media to finish the piece. After ten years of sketching with, in retrospect, a highly inferior product, I feel confident that these are just what I needed to take the next step toward improvement.These are very high quality. They arrive sharpened, which is nice, since I'm used to colored pencils that arrive in dozens and take hours to sharpen. They sharpen well with a standard or high quality sharpener, and the graphite (even on the softer pencils) is strong enough to not crack in the barrel (a problem I had with some student grade pencils in high school art class). The case is nice, too, and has a soft matte-like finish to the touch. I imagine it will dent and prove less than perfect if thrust into a backpack pocket full of other materials, but if kept in between notebooks, it probably has a long life ahead of it.I bought a set for my best friend, and she is in love, too. This would make a great gift for any artist in your life, and is a good investment for your own arsenal of supplies if you are an artists as well.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 24 July 2014

prod_name: Faber-Castell - Castell 9000 Art Set Pencil (Pack of 6), Green
title: Very good pencils, worth the money I spent on them
review: Very good pencils. I have used these and found them to be very nice to use.I've compared these to my Derwent graphic set (Medium), and I find these pencils to be better. With eh Derwent ones the lead used to break a lot while sharpening but I never had that issue with these Faber Castell Pencils. These pencils also have sharper edges on the outside so I found them more comfortable to hold and grip. This pencil also weights a little more so they didn't feel almost weightless which is better for me. Through my tests the leads last longer than Derwent too, I don't know why the composition must obviously be different but they do last longer and hold their point a bit better.That's about it really, overall I would recommend these over the Derwent ones I used. That's about it really. Just don't take my review to include colour pencils from the companies as that a different game altogether and I haven't used their coloured pencils, I try to give all brands a fair shot.And although this doesn't matter in terms of performance but the Faber Castell Pnecils look nicer and have a better coating on the pencils themselves. The tin looks nicer too. While this doesn't matter it's a bonus at least since I find the green colour very easy on the eyes and It's one of my favourite colours anyway.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 September 2019

title: Love this pack for the 3H 4H &5H pencils
review: This pack has the ones that go up to 5 H and I love this for drawing because you can get a delicate grey from the upper H pencilsFirst let me say that this brand is one of the best made around.  Even the higher H pencils aren‚Äôt scratchy and won‚Äôt ruin your paper!  How lovely is that?  I used to use a different brand but they started sending their business to mexico and their pencils are worthless.This brand is worth the $$ you will spend so don‚Äôt fret about if you are making a bad decision....you aren‚Äôt!The wood doesn‚Äôt split or crack and stays firm around the pencil point.  I carve off wood until some of my pencil tips are almost 2 or more inches, the use fine sandpaper to give me sharp points for the best of details.  You can see these in one of my above drawings

review: I‚Äôve used Faber Cattell water-soluble pencils for some time and I absolutely love them. The company also makes pencils with a very slight tint (blue, green and maybe others). These are called ‚ÄúGreen‚Äù so not unreasonably I thought they were tinted. It turns out they‚Äôre normal graphite and Green seems to refer to a type (rather than colour) of pencil. They come in a green tin. On checking I see that my other FB pencils are in a green tin, so I didn‚Äôt get what I wanted. However, they‚Äôre an excellent pencil and I shall carry on using them, but I‚Äôm still looking for a green tint‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶

review: Like most art supplies they don't come with any artistic abilities.Good for noodling around tho, and you have a good selection of different hardness to choose from to find your favourite.The pen are just pen, although of high quality, but it's the attention to detail and the TIN BOX that pushes me over to a 4 on this one. Great box that will last so you can keep your things in one place without it falling apart on you, it is this level of additional detail you expect when geting brand names, not just the higher pricepoint and nothing else.All that being said, they are pens, and pretty good ones from what my non artistic mind can tell.

title: Gute Bleistifte im praktischen 12er Set.
review: Versand/Lieferumfang:Die BIC Evolution Triangle HB Dreikant Bleistifte mit Radiergummi im 12er Pack kamen sicher verpackt und heil bei mir an.Funktionalit√§t/Optik/Qualit√§t/Anwendung:Die BIC Evolution Triangle Bleistift eignen sich gut zum zeichnen und schreiben.Sie haben eine blau-metallische Farbe und am Ende einen kleinen Radiergummi.Dieser ist, anders als es oft der Fall ist, qualitativ sogar wirklich gut; weder zu weich, noch zu hart, dass er das Papier verkratzt und schwachen bis mittelstarken Bleistiftaufdruck bekommt er gut weg.Durch den dreieckigen Schaft hat man einen guten und angenehmen Halt- und Schreibkomfort.Die Mine ist sehr bruchfest. Das Spitzen funktioniert durch die 3eckige Form nicht ganz m√ºhelos, wobei er sehr ergiebig ist, sodass nicht so schnell gespitzt werden muss. Die Bleistifte sind holzfrei, bestehen aus Kunstharz und splittern dementsprechend nicht, wenn sie zu Bruch gehen. Au√üerdem sind sie deshalb kaubest√§ndig.Die Minenst√§rke betr√§gt 4,3 mm und der H√§rtegrad ist HB.Fazit:Gute Bleistifte im praktischen 12er Set. F√ºrs Schreiben und Zeichnen gleicherma√üen gut und f√ºr kleinere Fehler auch gleich mit praktischem Radiergummi am Stift. Wirklich gut.Vielen Dank, dass Sie sich die Zeit genommen haben, meine Rezension durchzulesen.Ich hoffe, ich konnte Ihnen bei ihrer Entscheidung behilflich sein. üòä

title: Qualitativ hochwertiges Produkt
review: Bewertet werden die ‚ÄûBIC Evolution Triangle HB Dreikant Bleistifte mit Radiergummi - 12er Pack‚Äú.Verarbeitung & Benutzung--------------------------------------------------Die Firma BIC hat einen ergonomischen Bleistift entwickelt, der gut in der Hand liegt. Das gew√§hlte Material vom Bleistift ist extrem robust. Dabei l√§sst sich die Mine dennoch leicht anspitzen.Der Bleistift hat den H√§rtegrad HB, eine Mindestst√§rke von 4,3 mm und ist vollst√§ndig ohne Holz versehen. Interessant finde ich, dass der Hersteller angibt, dass der ganze Bleistift kaubest√§ndig ist. Ich kenne das aus meiner Schulzeit noch, dass ich das gerne gemacht habe, aber den Holzgeschmack nicht mochte.Fazit--------------------------------------------------Einen so robusten Bleistift hatte ich bisher noch nicht in der Hand. Zum Testen habe ich einen der 12 Bleistifte in der Mitte zerbrochen. Der Hersteller gibt an, dass durch das holzfreie Material das Produkt nicht splittert. Bei meinem Test konnte ich die Behauptung des Herstellers best√§tigen. Eine klare Kaufempfehlung meinerseits.Wenn der Beitrag euch gefallen hat, w√ºrde ich mich √ºber ein ‚Äûn√ºtzlich‚Äú freuen.

prod_name: Bic - Evolution Triangle - Triangular Pencils with Integrated Eraser - HB - Box of 12
title: Im Grunde toll
review: Die BIC Dreikant Bleistifte "Evolution" stellen erst auf den zweiten Blick eine neue Generation von Bleistiften dar.Das, was wie Holz aussieht, ist gar kein Holz, sondern Kunstharz.Den Unterschied sp√ºrt man weder beim Gebrauch, noch beim Spitzen, denn das ist alles wie gehabt.Die HB-Mine ist jedoch eine ganz normale Bleistiftmine von guter Qualit√§t.Dass sie in der Kunstharzh√ºlle besser gesch√ºtzt ist, als in einer Holzh√ºlle konnte ich bei normaler Verwendung nicht feststellen.Der Bleistiftk√∂per ist mit blauem Metalliclack √ºberzogen, sieht ganz schick aus.Am hinteren Ende befindet sich ein klassischer Aufsatz-Radiergummi in wei√ü. Wunder darf man von diesen Radiergummis nicht erwarten. Bei intensivem Gebrauch sind sie schnell aufgebraucht und nur noch die scharfkantige Blechh√ºlle ist √ºbrig und bei nur gelegentlichem Gebrauch verschmutzen und verfetten die Radiergummis und fangen an zu schmieren. Ich pers√∂nlich verwende stets einen ganz konventionellen Bleistift-Radiergummi in der gewohnten Riegelform.Trotzdem nur 4 Sterne, da mich im Angebotstext etwas wirklich st√∂rt.Da steht, dass beim Kauen auf dem Bleistift nichts absplittern kann.Also bitte. Man soll nicht auf dem Bleistift kauen! Und wer sich das wirklich nicht verkneifen kann, der ist mit einem nicht lackierten Echtholzbleistift bestimmt besser dran.Auf Kunstharz herumkauen? Wirklich??Wie auch immer, insgesamt ein ordentlicher Bleistift der seine erwartete Funktion hervorragend ausf√ºhrt.

prod_name: STAEDTLER 7755ABK25D Mars Micro Mechanical Pencil, 0.5mm (Blistercard of 1 + 12 HB Lead Refills)
title: My favourite Mechanical Pencil
review: This is my third pencil now of this model.My first one was stolen by my Sister. She had one herself, but she wanted to take mine on a University trip which involved a lot of time out in the field. When she got back, she conveniently lost 'my' pencil and not her own (I had grounds to believe that it was actually her pencil she lost - which I was eventually proved right when she confessed to her crime).Anyway, the tension got so heated at one point that she bought me a new one right there on the spot. I should add that this argument went on for months. I simple wanted a confession. That's how much these mechanical pencils mean to us!With my second copy, we went the distance together. What makes these pencils so great is that they just have this perfect weight and feel. It genuinely feels like quality and it's rare to find all of the graphite broken inside. You can really hit the darker tones of the HB quite effortlessly while being just as able to be used lightly and for speed taking notes.I used my first copy back when I was at University. I had to do a lot of technical drawings of architecture or infrastructure and I can honestly say that it always allowed me to deliver the quality of drawing that I had in mind. My second copy was mostly used for a lot of note-taking and the occasional drawing.My new copy, as displayed in the photograph, is mostly unused for now. I only bought this particular ASIN because it came with the additional graphite. This is only a couple of quid more expensive than just buying the supplies individually - so I figured why not have a backup!In any case, I am prepared this time if my Sister plans on another heist...
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 September 2018

prod_name: STAEDTLER 7755ABK25D Mars Micro Mechanical Pencil, 0.5mm (Blistercard of 1 + 12 HB Lead Refills)
title: Loved it so much I bought it twice!
review: Absolutely loved this mechanical pencil, I sadly lost the original one and didn't need to think twice before buying a second one. (I found the first one so now I have two!)The quality is great and the lead is strong but not too brittle. The pencil is not as dark as other HB pencils, which isn't really a problem for me as I use it for technical drawings rather than shading. After about a years use the silver painting on my pencil began to wear away, but that is the only difference between this one and my old one.My only problem with the product is the lead refill. The price of the product is great as the refill on its own is a good percentage of the price of the pen with the refill included. However the little tube the lead is in is not very secure. I left it in a small pencil case and after a few weeks the lid had fallen out and my refills had all been smashed to pieces. I was a little disappointed by this as I had been using cheap lead refills when doing sketches and using the staedtler lead sparingly, and as mentioned before the refills on their own are quite expensive, but worth it considering how many other wooden pencils I would have gone through had I not switched to mechanical.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 June 2017

title: La mejor
review: Tuve una igual que me dur√≥ 1 a√±o us√°ndola todos los d√≠as. Me gust√≥ tanto que he repetido la compra. He de decir que la anterior la cambi√© porque me cay√≥ y la pis√© sin querer. Anteriormente hab√≠a utilizado de Rotring que aunque no es mala, no tiene la punta retr√°ctil y finalmente la goma de agarre se acab√≥ rompiendo poco a poco en pedacitos. Tambi√©n tuve una Faber-Caster de punta retr√°ctil que es bastante similar a la Staedler.√âsta tiene un agarre firme y ergon√≥mico, con goma suave en la punta. Al escribir, no resbala ni gira.En mi caso, tengo la mala costumbre de hacer demasiada fuerza al escribir por lo que las minas de 0,5 las devoro, teniendo que usar en una lapicera normal minas de 0,7 mm. Con ellas el trazo para escritura en mi opini√≥n queda demasiado ancho y ensucia mucho el papel. Gracias a portaminas como esta y su punta retr√°ctil, puedo utilizar minas de 0,5 porque ese movimiento de muelle que tiene en la punta absorbe la fuerza que hago de m√°s.Otra cosa que debo decir es que, si tienes la t√©cnica de girar la lapicera a la vez que vas escribiendo para ir afilando la mina, con este portaminas puedes hacerlo de forma c√≥moda gracias al agarre sim√©trico que tiene.As√≠ que estoy encantado con ella y si est√°s buscando un portaminas de calidad a un buen precio, yo no me lo pensar√≠a m√°s, es la tuya.

prod_name: STAEDTLER 7755ABK25D Mars Micro Mechanical Pencil, 0.5mm (Blistercard of 1 + 12 HB Lead Refills)
title: The best available in India, mechanical pencil .5 mm
review: Hi have spent about 3000 rupees and about 1 dozen different kinds of of mechanical pencils I have used but this is the the best among them.I use pental refill 4B in it. And the pencil does not break as all of other do. Of course a little force will break the tip. I have also purchase .3 mm of the same brand but the refill, the lead keeps breaking until I use a pental refill. I have ordered and I am waiting for that I hope it will not break. I give for stars because it needs lots of improvement.But take my word you can purchase it with your closed eye and you will never regret. The Germans have had been master of metallurgy technology since World war II. Japanese brands I have used make dramatic presentation but quality is missing that's why they are our one of the best friends in India. -Dr Pancholi.

title: Feels Premium and good to use
review: The built quality is good. Feels premium to hold and write. Use staedtler leads for smooth writing. Although, the lead is loosely held at the tip while clicking. Due to its weight and steel tip, leads break quite often. A single click pushes the lead more than it is required and therefore the lead travel has to be adjusted manually. I have used mars 777 and graphite 777 mechanical pencil so these minor details could have been well taken care of in this product. Slightly over priced.

title: Deceptive product Photo
review: I placed an order for this product on September 4, 2013, one day before the review by another customer thinking that we were getting a package of 8 HB pencils.  I am absolutely disgusted that Amazon would show such a photo when there was only a single pencil.  Shame on you Amazon....  I have done a lot of business with Amazon over the years and I have never had a product misrepresented like this.  I hope that Amazon would forward an apology to those who have ordered this and make good and send to us the other 7 pencils shown and make sure that this does not happen again!Feel betrayed!
date: Reviewed in the United States on 11 September 2013

title: and I loved it. Recently I came to the States

Recently I came to the States, and I left my pencil home, so I reordered the same pencil but different color (Red, which is even nicer in real) . I fall in love with it each time I use it. The grip is so comfy,  it looks very nice  and its very comfortable while writing. The tip is durable, its metal so it lasts for ever if you take good care of it. The eraser is also great . Love it and I highly recommend it if you love writing using pencils. It worth every penny!

title: Very Good Quality - Worth a Few Dollars More
review: I had been using the Papermate "Titanium" series pencils for many years and was satisfied.  I happened to see these Faber-Castell pencils online and was intrigued by the photo.  I bought the blue, red, and blackberry with .7mm lead.  These pencils are definitely a step up in quality.  They are engineered with a superior ergonomic grip, a long twist-up eraser, and very stable tip.  The lead that came with them has just the right hardness and writes smoothly.  I like the larger diameter of the pencil, and the thin band of metal that is visible above the grip is a nice visual accent.  The colored barrels are plastic but the pencil has sufficient weight from the lower metal portion.

title: Perfekt f√ºr mich
review: Der Druckbleistift von Bic gef√§llt mir viel besser als die bisher benutzten normalen Bleistifte. Das ist zum einen das feine Schriftbild, das ich konstant erzeugen kann, in dem ich den Bleistift immer mal wieder drehe. Spitzen ist nat√ºrlich nicht erforderlich und wenn ich mich mal verschrieben habe, kann ich das blitzschnell mit dem integrierten Radiergummi korrigieren. Wenn man diesen vorsichtig herausdreht, finde man auch die beiden Ersatzminen.Durch einfaches Dr√ºcken wird die Mine weiter herausgeschoben und bleibt dann auch drau√üen. Zur√ºck kann man sie nicht dr√ºcken, wenn man zu oft gedr√ºckt hat, bedeutet das eine weit herausstehende Mine, die man dann vorsichtig runterschreiben sollte. Deshalb finde ich die Stifte f√ºr unterwegs nicht so gut geeignet. An der Seite befindet sich ein Clip, damit kann ich den Stift sehr gut an meinem Block befestigen.Ich habe die Stifte in 2 verschiedenen Minenst√§rken ausprobiert, kann da jetzt aber keine gravierenden Unterschiede feststellen. In beiden St√§rken kann ich sehr fein schreiben.Ich werde die Stifte definitiv nachkaufen, aber das wird noch lange dauern, denn selbst ein Vielschreiber wie ich wird ewig mit den Stiften auskommen.

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Favourite pencil but matte black!
review: ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏èIch habe den rOtring 800 Druckbleistift mit Einzug in der 0,7 mm Variante in Schwarz erworben und bin absolut begeistert von diesem Stift.Die Mechanik dieses Druckbleistifts ist einfach herausragend. Die einfahrbare Spitze ist nicht nur praktisch, sondern verleiht dem Stift auch eine zus√§tzliche Eleganz. Die Pr√§zision beim Schreiben ist beeindruckend, und die 0,7 mm Mine erm√∂glicht ein sauberes und genaues Schriftbild.Die Haptik des rOtring 800 ist erstklassig. Das Gewicht des Stifts liegt angenehm in der Hand, und die Griffigkeit ist perfekt. Man sp√ºrt sofort, dass hier hochwertige Materialien verwendet wurden, was dem Stift eine robuste und langlebige Qualit√§t verleiht.Obwohl der Preis dieses Druckbleistifts etwas h√∂her ist, ist er meiner Meinung nach jeden Cent wert. Die Qualit√§t und das Design rechtfertigen den Preis voll und ganz. Der rOtring 800 ist nicht nur ein Schreibger√§t, sondern auch ein Hingucker auf meinem Schreibtisch. Die schwarze Farbe verleiht ihm eine zeitlose Eleganz.Insgesamt bin ich √§u√üerst zufrieden mit meinem Kauf und kann den rOtring 800 Druckbleistift allen empfehlen, die nach einem hochwertigen und pr√§zisen Schreibinstrument suchen ‚Äì vorausgesetzt, der Preis spielt keine allzu gro√üe Rolle.Unter anderen kann ich auch die Kugelschreiberversion dergleichen Linie ,dem ich auch in Besitz habe genauso bedenkenlos empfehlen.

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: MATITA MECCANICA VERAMENTE OTTIMA, SICURAMENTE NON REGALATA
review: I‚Äôve been using the silver pencil for a while and have enjoyed it very much. The black one wasn‚Äôt available at MRSP on Amazon at the time, so I bought the silver one instead. I bought the black one as soon as I saw it was available again.

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Es calidad
review: Ho utilizzato la matita in questione (rotring 800 mina 0,7) per un paio di settimane al lavoro tutto il giorno come unico strumento di scrittura e disegno (oltre che a casa per diletto o per prendere qualche appunto a caso) e quindi mi sento pronto a dare un mio parere. Sono un impiegato tecnico (ingegnere civile) in uno studio di ingegneria, quindi per una cosa o per l'altra in studio scrivo o faccio qualche schizzo prettamente a matita, per abitudine soprattutto, ma √® per dire che ho modo di usarla molto la matita. L'oggetto in questione √® costruito in modo impeccabile, veramente bella ed elegante e trasmette veramente solidit√†, pi√π di quanto mi aspettassi. Il meccanismo di estrazione della punta funziona bene, l'estrazione della mina per esigenze costruttive non √® la pi√π appagante che abbia mai provato (ma va benissimo) e il tutto funzione senza incertezze. La cosa che pi√π mi spaventava era il peso, perch√® gia in passato passando dal classico porta mine economico di plastica a questi in metallo il limite che alla fine mi aveva fatto tornare ai primi √® il peso, che con un uso intenso dopo un p√≤ stanza veramente. In questo caso, seppur la matita non sia sicuramente leggera, anzi, il fatto che si riesca a impugnare molto vicino alla punta fa si che non si percepisca molto il suo peso in mano e quindi devo dire che alla fine non mi stanca particolarmente nella scrittura (nel disegno di solito si avverte meno la cosa per il movimento pi√π lento). Riguardo al presunto problema del puntale che traballa nella sua sede essendo estraibile devo dire che durante l'utilizzo veramente bisogna impegnarsi sul serio per riuscire a percepire qualcosa, per me non sussiste proprio come impedimento, anche se sicuramente rispetto alla sua sorella inore con punta fissa o a una qualsiasi altra matita meccanica senza punta estraibile se si va a giocare col dito sulla punta non trasmette la stessa fermezza dell'elemento. In conclusione devo dire che sono soddisfatto della matita, sono contento di essermi levato questo sfizio, perch√® di sfizio si tratta, dato che il prezzo √® sicuramente elevato se pensiamo che √® una matita meccanica e non √® che rispetto a quelle da 5 euro vadda chiss√† quanto meglio, si scrive pressoch√© uguale, l'unica differenza √® la piacevole sensazione che ragala come strumento pi√π esclusivo e di estetica e dato che la amtita la uso tutto il giorno volevo togliermi lo sfizio di averne una che mi piacesse tanto.

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: The last pencil you‚Äôll need
review: Para mi es el Ferrari de los portaminas, es caro porque marca la diferencia, hay muchos mas baratos y tambi√©n muy buenos, pero sin llegar a la calidad de este. Es un capricho que luego disfrutas mucho.

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: rOring 800 is Awesome!
review: While this is a premium product and an intimidating price tag for a mechanical pencil, this product is beautiful and meticulously designed.ProsThe retractable tip helps prevent the tip from being bent and breaking, unlike all other pencils with this design.The grip is excellent and the weight distribution allows it to sit comfortably in the hand.This product is of a high quality and I have not experienced a mechanical failure for the three pencils I own in over 5 years.Neutral / preferenceThis pencil is nearly entirely made of metal; as such, it is very heavy. Personally, this is a pro and makes it feel like a quality product.ConsYou may as well assume that this thing doesn‚Äôt come with an eraser, just a lead stopper.If you get a ding on the pencil, the paint will be removed and exposed the raw metal beneath (eye sore for perfectionists).Due to the heavy weight, this pencil is difficult to write quickly with or do pencil tricks with.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 1 November 2023

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Premium pencil!!!
review: The rOring 800 is awesome. The negative reviews that say there is some tip wobble are way over blown on this aspect. There is a very little bit of wobble as there has to be in a moving part. This is consistent as I have several of these for my work. They all have the same amount of tip wobble.  Those reviewers who have such an issue with this aspect never actually discuss how the pencil performs tip wobble or not. In practice the minuscule tip wobble is simply not an issue. It is an outstanding pencil. I am an artist and use it all the time as well as the rOtring 600 and Graphgear 1000. These all have their strengths and purpose as do other pencils...even the wooden ones. The 800 is a wonderful tool and built extremely well and the retractable tip works as it should and makes this a travel friendly alternative to the 600. And ...it is a pencil folks...write with it, draw with it, enjoy it.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 1 April 2021

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: The tip wobble really isn't that bad
review: No doubt if you are looking into a 45 quid pencil you'll be doing your research. And some of that will lead you to a lot of people saying that the retractable Rotring has a slight tip wobble (because it's moving parts). I've been using this daily for  over a year now and it's still going strong. I'm a massive fidgetter so I'm constantly popping the nib in and out and taking the rubber protector on and off and it's still not gotten to a point where it's worn or damaged. This is my favourite pencil. It weighs a really nice amount for me and feels like a good bit of kit.The improvements I think it could do with are minor. The first is the little tab thing that you slide it onto shirt pockets and what not. I think this should not be painted. This area is the one that gets the most wear and naturally the paint chips. It'd made more sense to plain finish it. The second is the availability of the rubbers. The rubbers last ages but they are a little difficult to pickup, in the end I opted to go for the ones direct from their site because they are a special size and didn't want to get the wrong ones.Besides that though I really like the pencil. I'd definitely recommend it if you are looking to upgrade to a something proper.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 March 2019

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: One Mech pencil to rule them all.
review: German engineering... Do I need to say anything else?As an engineer myself, I've always preferred mechanical pencils to take notes, sketch & "do math" on.Habit I developed since before university. My last mechanical pencil was a Blue Pentel 0.7mm that I first purchased before getting into Uni and used it throughout all my Uni study & exams.I unfortunately lost that pencil while moving homes and needed to purchase my next "companion" for the future and possibly the "last" one I'll ever purchase.I had heard about rOtring Mechanical pencils and decided to purchase one as a gift to myself & as the tool it is. I have no complains about this pencil, I do not have complaints about the retractable tip being "flimsy" at all.. I use this for taking notes and "doing math" and sometimes sketches. I absolutely love the way the pencil feels in my hand while I write.Build quality is great and the pencil feels like a proper writing tool and not like a toy as some of these other mechanical pencils. It is a sturdy, well designed tool.The only "complain" I have, which I have will all pens/ mechanical pencils is due to the fact I have large hands, the "clip" is something I remove from all my pens/ mech pencils if they get in the way of my grip/ where the "clip" typically would rest on the hand. But that isn't something specific about this product as I do it to all my handwriting utensils.Hopefully I have purchased the last mechanical pencil I'll ever use and I have no regrets.

Suite √† de nombreuses correspondances.Pensez √† utiliser la garantie internationale et passer par le site Rotring !Depuis le remplacement plus aucun probl√®me et c'est un tr√®s bel outil d'√©criture.

title: Most beautiful and well designed tool on my desk.
review: Without doubt, the best mechanical pencil I have ever bought. In fact I would go as far as to say it is the best writing tool I have ever purchased.The build quality is flawless. Solid metallic components everywhere. Really solid mechanism for revealing and retracting the tip.Loading can be a little fiddly and frustrating but this has been the case for every mechanical pencil I have ever had.I previously had one of these but the tip was bent by someone whilst I was away from my desk. Either that or the product failed. Replacement works just as well.Recommend the 0.7 over the 0.5 as 0.5mm Lead is very fragile and I found it breaks frequently.HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

title: Broke after a month.
review: I have owned a variety of mechanical pencils, ranging from cheap to expensive brands, and most have lasted me 18+ years. I decided to give this brand a try after it was highly recommended, but unfortunately, it stopped working after only a month. The twisting mechanism at the top does not function properly, and the tip does not stay steady enough for me to write a single letter. I am baffled and don‚Äôt even know how this could have happened. Truthfully, a $0.99 mechanical pencil is more reliable and lasts longer than this supposedly well-known product. It has been an absolute waste of time and money. I even tried to fix it without success. The bottom line is that I will never purchase anything from this brand again. I had high hopes and was enthusiastic about the product, but unfortunately, it has been nothing but a disappointment and an absolute waste of money. Thank you.

El agarre es perfecto, su peso es perfecto para manejarlo c√≥modamente, es precioso, y su sistema para retraer la punta es magn√≠fico y transmite muy buenas sensaciones.Tengamos en cuenta que Rotring se ha centrado, en cuanto a materia de escritura, en sus l√°pices, y este es el m√°s alto de su gama.Un saludo.

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: ... the Rotring 800 I wasn't sure that I would like this pencil
review: Reading the mixed reviews on the Rotring 800 I wasn't sure that I would like this pencil. Also looking at the photos I thought the gold accents looked cheap. In person this pencil looks anything but cheap. The gold, black and red is truly nice together. The Rotring 800 looks like a quality instrument. When you pick it up and start to write it‚Äôs even better. The mechanism that extends the sleeve has a satisfied spring. The pencil is well balanced and nicely weighted. One of the main concerns people have with the 800 is the sleeve. There is a little bit of movement. This is true but not enough for me to complain. I work in the interior design industry and hand draw floor plans for carpets, rugs and furniture. I also take notes and write quotes with the Rotring. That little bit of movement has not affected my experience with the pencil. I need to be able to carry the pencil in my shirt pocket or planner as well. The retractable sleeve was the deciding factor to pick the 800 over the 600.

title: Jolly clever, but not as good as the 600
review: The retractable point is a two edged sword - it's nice to protect ones' pockets, but it simply doesn't support the lead as well as the fixed point of the 600, and so as a serious writing and drawing tool this falls a little sort of it's junior sibling. The lack of a lead grade indicator really consigns this pencil to 'more is less' status.

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Nice but‚Ä¶
review: I bought this pencil to round out my ROtring collection‚Ä¶ the Rapid Pro, Newton, 600, and now the 800.  Of pencils, I prefer the Rapid Pro for EDC.The 800 has a retractable tip, but it‚Äôs almost 1/2‚Äù long.  The thicker base is about 1/4‚Äù and the part that hold the lead is 1/4‚Äù.  And the twist then click motion to begin writing is excessive.The 600‚Äôs tip doesn‚Äôt retract so it can easily be damaged if dropped or mishandled.I have what I believe is a Newton pencil‚Ä¶ it only says ROTRING on the barrel and has a smooth, not checkered grip.  This also has a retracting tip, but I prefer the checkered grip.

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Lead Diameter fussy
review: Great engineering pencil , with one tiny flaw . The one I have hates lead that is 0.69 dia  (in a typical pack you will have a tolerance range of 0.68-0.71mm ) and this pencil has a grip intolerance  :-) other than having to mic a few leads to get this one to work , it is my go to pencil for life
date: Reviewed in the United States on 11 December 2023

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: The sliding collar tolerance is, unfortunately, abysmal.
review: I really, really really wanted to like this pencil due to the retractable tip and ability to carry it around without worry. Unfortunately the amount of play in the tip is so great that it simply can't be ignored. I read a ton of reviews , watched loads of videos and bought this thinking that it can't be as bad as people made out in certain reviews but it unfortunately is.There is absolutely no reason why a pencil that clearly has top end machining and solidity elsewhere in the body has such an unacceptable amount of play in the KEY part of the pencil. To be clear, the part that extends and retracts has visible and very noticeable radial play between it and the section it slides up and down in to the point that it audibly clacks when you're writing with it. It should be approaching an interference fit and be absolutely solid as a fixed tip for something that costs as much as it does.It's current lax production format may be fine for casual writers and people coming to it green with few expectations or less demanding technical/precision needs but when you compare it to its fixed tip sibling, the 600, or the literal solid and precise, bones of your hand extension that the Pentel P205 is and writes like (still in my humble opinion the greatest mechanical pencil on the planet today), the difference is night and day.Can't recommend this at all and if you're thinking about it, I'd say buy the 600 in the tip diameter you want without any worries and buy yourself another four P205s with the money saved and fit a variety of different hardness leads in them for fun and variety. You'll be infinitely happier and better equipped in day to day pencil options.Sorry Rotring. For this to be your flagship pencil, you really should be doing better. Either sort your sliding mechanism tolerances out or add a sexy screw on cap to the 600, charge a fiver more for it and dump the 800.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 September 2023

(on certain angles it is not)The push button on 800 is hard and also jiggly due to having a little extra room for lead sleeve parts.I like the 600's material better.The lead sleeve of 600 always is out and sharp and fragile.So, if you do not drop your pencil a lot (and break the sleeve lead of 600) and if you have a pencil casethen 600 is good.
