review: This is the best mechanical pencil I have ever bought.There are a few reviews on here about the tip wobbles, well, I have to tell you there is no wobble on mine.The weight and balance is spot on and very comfortable in the hand.The retractable nib is a nice touch. I love it.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 May 2022

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Pencil has serious quality issues
review: I love Rotring pencils.  In general they are essentially the best drafting pencils around, both the Rotring Rapid Pro and the Rotring 600 are simply superb.  Having said all this it pains me to have to leave a negative review on the Rotring 800, but what can I say?  It is simply a bad product that is ridiculously overpriced.  Rotring touts the 800 as their cream of the crop mechanical pencil and it has a nifty twist mechanism, which pops in and out and makes the pencil pocket friendly by removing the sharp point.  And yes this twist mechanism does work; however, when you try to write with the pencil you will notice a lot of play in the metal tip.  Folks a mechanical drafting pencil is suppose to be precise.  Having a loose tip defeats the whole purpose of precise writing.  The pencil does look quite attractive, however; that is why it gets two stars.  Otherwise it is complete garbage.  If you want a high quality drafting pencil then buy either the Rotring Rapid Pro or the Rotring 600.  If you want a pocket safe pencil then get the Rapid Pro.  If you are not worried about the sharp point then buy the legendary Rotring 600.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 9 May 2015

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color

Every time pressure was applied.  I would tighten it then !SLIP!.Sorry for the dramatics but I was really sad it broke.It was a lovely weight metallic angular feel, the propelling mechanism is smooth and tight and it was otherwise a joy to own.It was way too expensive to simply break in normal use.

title: Disappointing after the 600

The mechanism seems to pinch the lead too hard unlike the 600. The broken pieces are always the same length. I have a massive collection of them. I went back to the 600 and it felt like the leads were lasting forever. The 800 is poor effort for the huge price. (I cannot sing the praises of the 600 enough though- beautiful in every way- except to transport with fragile pointy nib; I wish they would just have a lid!)

prod_name: Faber-Castell 111260 Colour Pencils (Pack of 60),3.5 x 18.6 x 21 cm; 399.16 Grams
title: Another  Amazing  Faber-Castell  Set.
review: I'm an adult  colorist  who finds coloring  a very enjoyable and  relaxing  hobby.  I  typically  will shy away from expensive  professional  artist  brands of media.  For that reason  Rose Art and Crayola were my go to brands  for non-water color pencils. That was until trying  the Faber-Castell  set of 12 Metallic  pencils and being  very impressed with  them.  I returned  to  purchase this box of 48 classic  color  pencils.  Just  like the  metallics I found them to be the best color pencils  I have  used to date.At that time  I compared  them to  eye brow  pencils for their almost  creamy textures.  Where you don't  need to  apply very much  pressure to apply the colors  onto various  types  of  paper.  The  leads don't  drag or break off . Nor does the color rub off your art work onto your hands or other surfaces.  My experience  has been that this is true  of this box of 48, which does include 2 of the metallic  colors  Gold and silver.  The colors are  richer and more vibrant  then Rose Art pencils which I  thought  were very vibrant  at the time I first purchased  them a few years ago.The  only  difference  that I  feel is worth mentioning  is that , included  in this box is a small pencil sharpener  for the  semi - hexagon  shaped  barrels Faber-Castell  pencils are known for.  It does  work  well in my experience . Without the  fusteration of broken leads that come with sharpeners that look similar to the  one included.These pencils  blend together  as well as my set of Royal-Langnickel water colors  do.  I  especially  like how  easily  I've been able to  use my Faber-Castell sets along with  my Bic  permanent  markers  and fineliners,  or  my Super Doodle and Lolliz gel pensBased on  this experience  I would  highly  recommend these pencils to colorists of all ages.

prod_name: Faber-Castell 111260 Colour Pencils (Pack of 60),3.5 x 18.6 x 21 cm; 399.16 Grams
title: Colour blending
review: The last colour pencil I had was twenty years ago, and it was a set of 48 colour pencils from other brand. This is a huge increase in terms of the choice of colours, which is a luxury, and at the same time, new experience. Please note, I have only tried those colours in blue. Here are my thoughts: (1) some of the colours blend in very well with each other, even up to four colours of blue blend in with each other as if it is natural.(2) not every colour blend, some stand up as it's own and can never be blended with others. I assume these are best for the "light" as shown in the pictures. It stands alone, so you don't need to worry these colours will get "intruded" by others.(3) there are some -to my surprise - has some shinny powder incorporated into the colour, the idea behind is really nice, as they are supposed to "reflect and shine" on the paper. However, pressure on these colours will actually reveal a dark-greyish colour instead of luxury reflective colour. Do note that I am still getting a hold on these colours, my impression on these new shine powder incorporated into colour pencils might change over time.Overall I am satisfied, and please note: never let the colour pencils fall from the table, the colour breaks instantly.Updates:Drew the last picture, and I am actually quite satisfied with the performance of the color pencil. Those few pencil with shiny powder incorporated can never be used to blend with other colors, but it has its own specialty and perhaps I might able to use them one day in some special things.

review: 72er Set  im Karton mit Kartonaufsteller, 13,89‚Ç¨Die Stifte sind weich und cremig, sehr gut pigmentiert und sehr gut lackiert, haben Farbnummern und auf der R√ºckseite ein wei√ües Beschriftungsfeld f√ºr den Namen. Die Stiftenden sind gerade abgeschnitten und unlackiert.Die Minen zerbrechen kaum und lassen sich sehr gut anspitzen. Ein √úbereinanderlegen von mehreren Farbschichten ist ebenfalls gut m√∂glich. Radieren lassen sie sich gut mit einem weichen wei√üen oder transparenten Radierer.Von der Farbzusammenstellung her sind es kr√§ftige Farben, die sich vor allem f√ºr den Schulunterricht eignen d√ºrften. Gedeckte Farbt√∂ne hingegen zum Zeichnen von naturalistischen Landschaften, Pflanzen, Tieren, Portraits etc. fehlen bis auf gedecktes Olivgr√ºn. Ansonsten sind alle Farben klar, kr√§ftig und leuchtend. Es gibt keine doppelten Farbt√∂ne. Dazu kommen 5 Metallic-Stifte in Violett, Mittelblau, Blaugr√ºn, Gold und Silber, die einen ganz dezenten Schimmer haben.Farbzusammenstellung: wenige Gelb- und Oranget√∂ne, sehr viele Rot- und Pinkt√∂ne, eine gute Auswahl an Blaut√∂nen, eine auf den ersten Blick etwas unharmonische Auswahl an Gr√ºnt√∂nen, eine gute Auswahl an Braunt√∂nen und zwei Graut√∂ne. Dazu Wei√ü und Schwarz. Das Wei√ü kann man zum Malen auf dunklem Papier verwenden, zum Setzen von Glanzlichtern auf anderen Farben eignet es sich nicht, da es nicht stark genug pigmentiert ist. Wenn man die Gr√ºntone nach Farbnuancen (gelblich, bl√§ulich, br√§unlich) und nach Helligkeitsstufen ordnet, ergibt die Auswahl Sinn.Die Minen sind von der H√§rte her alle gleicherma√üen weich bis auf ein helles Gelbgr√ºn und Ocker. Diese beiden Stifte sind in meiner Packung schw√§cher pigmentiert und deutlich h√§rter.Die leichte Kartonage ist wahrscheinlich nur zum Verkauf und Versand gedacht, nicht zur dauerhaften Aufbewahrung. Der Aufsteller aus d√ºnnem Karton ist standhaft und geschmackvoll.Einzelstifte kann man nicht nachkaufen. Eine Farbkarte des Herstellers gibt es auch nicht.Merkw√ºrdig ist, dass Faber-Castell in denselben roten Verpackungen, gleichg√ºltig ob Kartonage oder Metallkasten, zwei verschiedene Qualit√§ten vermarktet: Neben der oben beschriebenen eher weichen Qualit√§t auch noch eine weitere, die eher h√§rtere Minen besitzt, keine Farbnummern und kein Namensfeld hat und auch etwas d√ºnner lackiert ist. Wenn man eine Packung kauft, wei√ü man nicht, welche Qualit√§t man bekommt.Fazit: sehr gute Stifte f√ºr Kinder und Jugendliche zu einem hervorragenden Preis, ansprechend aufzubewahren im  Karton-Aussteller. Die  Farbauswahl sollte vom Hersteller einmal etwas √ºberarbeitet werden, dann k√∂nnen sie auch von Erwachsenen gut benutzt werden (weniger Rot- und Pinkt√∂ne, mehr Gelb- und Orangefarben, ein Creme-Farbton und ein stark pigmentiertes Wei√ü). Ein Nachkauf von Einzelstiften anhand der Farbnummern auf der Webseite des Herstellers w√§re w√ºnschenswert, ebenso eine ausdruckbare Farbkarte. Des Weiteren sollte sich der Hersteller einmal f√ºr EINE Qualit√§t, vorzugsweise f√ºr die weichere, entscheiden.

title: Decent pencils..
review: These are oil based so they have a harder core & hold a super sharp tip for detailed work. Only downside is they are a bit muted in color. The shade represented on the barrel is brighter than the actual color on the page. I do appreciate the 4 metallic colored pencils. Prompt shipping from seller.
date: Reviewed in the Netherlands on 17 September 2023

prod_name: Faber-Castell 111260 Colour Pencils (Pack of 60),3.5 x 18.6 x 21 cm; 399.16 Grams
title: Lots of pretty colours to play with
reviewer: I haven't received this at all. I got a message from the DHL that they dropped it in the postbox! I stayed home the whole day because i was expecting it.
review: Like that they have a hard sharp point for detail. They sharpen well. No breakages so far which is a big plus! So many nice colours. I'd like names so figuring navy, black etc and some of the reds, greys would be easier. But as a budget pencil I guess can't be too fussy? Like that the whole barrell shows the colour even if it isn't exact. I have other pencils with coloured ends and the are so hard to find in my tray. Pleased to have a selection of greys. I should make the effort to learn their numbers maybe to save time? You can't put many layers sadly but with so many colours and how they an affordable set it's not such a big deal. Blending requires a soft touch. Not so easy as softer pencils. Because they are a harder pencil, beware wreaking the surface of your paper esp when you have that nice sharp point. It's made me realise I probably don't need a huge fancy set of over a hundred colours as the more you have the more confusing it gets choosing and finding colours. I was feeling limited using 12 and 24 colour sets and this budget friendly set was a chance to experience more choice. Main point is if you learn how to work with them and you can create some nice pictures. I like softer pencils more but appreciate the lack of constant shapening and breakage I was getting with my other set. And how detail is so much easier.

prod_name: Derwent Graphic Soft Graphite Drawing Pencils, Ideal For Illustrating & Shading, Set Of 12, Professional Quality, 34215
title: Derwents are some of the best around
reviewer: Mz Nina, business consultant and aspiring artist
review: I looove this brand, also all their colored pencil lines.  I know everyone is Prismacolor crazy, but it is hype.  Derwents are just as good and I am a little partial to them simply they are the ones I learn to draw with even as a kid.  I remember my first Derwent kit that Dad bought me, 120 pencils and I was around 8 and we were livi9ng in Australia.I love the water color pencils, the graphite, the ink tense that you can actually draw on fabric with and it stays, and the color soft line.  I also have a few others, but those are my favorites.I would say there pencils are as good as any other including Prismacolor.Just make sure to get the right pencil sharpener no matter what you use.  Get a Derwent battery operated, which is still made or a Panasonic or a used HUNT-Boston, all of which are no longer made.  DO NOT GET X-ACTO, it chews your pencils up and constantly breaks the lead.INFO ON ELECTRIC PENCIL SHARPENERS:I am a color pencil artist, and you need to have either a Panasonic, "Hunt-Boston" pencil sharpener, otherwise your colored pencils are eaten.  NEVER BUY X-ACTO for colored pencils, X-ACTO will eat your pencils.  Until you can find a Panasonic or Hunt-Boston, or Hunt or Boston electric pencil sharpener, get this if you can find one, or the Derwent "BLACK" model as it had 2 holes, one for a longer tip and one for a shorter tip.  I have both.  I had bought the Derwent one as I have Derwent but also use Prismacolor and graphite.  Panasonic and Hunt Boston are NO LONGER MADE no matter WHAT anyone says.  I was lucky to buy a new PANASONIC electric pencil sharpener by trolling the net until I found on.  Bought a used Boston, model #18, used on eBay and paid waaaay too much.  It was pretty beaten up.Also, if you do buy used, get one in the best quality that you can and just pay the extra, I would say up to $35.  I personally would not spend more than that.  I paid $38 for my new Panasonic.Also, X-ACTO bought out "Hunt-Boston" and all new models are a 4 digit model number, the actual "Hunt-Boston" is only a 2 digit.  This issue is that X-ACTO still sells under the Hunt Boston name, and it is misleading as it now uses X-ACTO cutters, which do NOTHING but EAT your pencils.  I also do not like it when someone lies about what they are selling.I bought what I thought was a "HUNT" electric pencil sharpener, it came in a box that had the Hunt name and packaging, but when I opened it up it was a, you guessed right...  An X-ACTO!!  Said so right on the sharpener.Bought on line here at Amazon from Overstock.com, but I returned it and got a refund, including shipping as they were misleading.Hope this helps with those of you who are colored pencil artist.  Get a PANASONIC, HUNT-BOSTON or Derwent sharpener.Also, run a graphite pencil through your sharpener first thing every day and it will stay sharp longer since colored pencils are waxy and tend to build up on the cutters.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 18 February 2013

prod_name: Derwent Graphic Soft Graphite Drawing Pencils, Ideal For Illustrating & Shading, Set Of 12, Professional Quality, 34215
title: 9h softer than 8h, otherwise perfect pencils.
review: So I did swatches of all the pencils I received (bought 12 hard and 12 soft sets) and was surprised at how dark 9h looked. I then start a swatch with 8h and it was much lighter. I thought maybe I just pressed lighter on the 8h, I continued with the rest of the pencils, and everything was perfect. So I did more comparisons of 8h and 9h with drawing lines, different shading, etc, and 9h is definitely darker than 8h, but whatever, I at least now know what to expect from both those pencils, probably just a lull in quality assurance that day. So a star off for that, butt other than that, great pencils, will buy again for their great price and (hopefully more reliable) quality.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 17 December 2015

prod_name: Derwent Graphic Soft Graphite Drawing Pencils, Ideal For Illustrating & Shading, Set Of 12, Professional Quality, 34215
title: Great Starter Range Pencils
review: I love the quality of these pencils. I am taking a drawing class for the first time this semester and the range these pencils give me is great. I've had my teacher tell several other students that their supplies weren't adequate but has always just focused on showing me how to use mine. I don't know too much about pencils but if you're looking for a great starter range I would recommend this set.The only down side I have for the pencils is that the case doesn't allow for easy viewing and the pencils fall out fairly easily. However, I didn't really consider the case a huge deal because it stores them perfectly in transit. I just think it would be nice if the pencils snapped in and had a label along the bottom (not on the pencil) to know which pencil you're grabbing (because the pencils will rotate in the case).
date: Reviewed in the United States on 4 November 2013

prod_name: Derwent Graphic Soft Graphite Drawing Pencils, Ideal For Illustrating & Shading, Set Of 12, Professional Quality, 34215
title: Great quality, great condition
review: This product only took a day to deliver. I also live in Canada, so that might be different for others. The graphite is pretty resistant to breaking, lays down graphite smoothly, and is pretty dark. It's not the darkest or smoothest I've drawn with, but it is super affordable. The overall quality of the pencils are still very good, artist quality. They're great for quick sketches, but excel in detailed sketches.

prod_name: Multi-Talented Pencil - STABILO woody 3 in 1 - Pack of 10 - Assorted Colours with Sharpener
title: Fantastic - strong colour like felt tip but writes like crayon
review: These are much chunkier than any toddler mark making tools I've used before but are easy to hold and use with their non slip grip wood pencil like outer. They are round rather than the often found triangular grip but this means you can sharpen them with the oversized sharpener included.I did balk at the cost of this set but I think these crayons that look like pencils and are as strong a colour as felt tips are worth it. The drawing you can do with them is strong and colourful - much brighter than colouring pencils and you can even draw on glass and plastic with the mess easily removed with something like a baby wipe. Like crayon though it doesn't mark fabric well so greater protection for things like your carpet and sofa. I have tried scribbling on my brown fabric sofa and the brighter colours like red did make a line but it only took a baby wipe to remove compared to lots of scrubbing needed with crayola washable markers.You get that soft flowing feel crayon feeling in use - like silk crayons rather than the scratchy normal pencil feel.I will buy these over normal pencils again for my toddlers. 4+ will probably prefer more grown up looking pencils as these definitely look like toddler ones.Update 25/10/16 still love these and I've gone on to purchase the pack of 18 which is even better as you get a black plastic storage tray plus a paintbrush and sharpener in fitted sections. Once over painted with water the colours do fade a lot to look like watercolour. See before and after pumpkin pic.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 September 2016

Jetzt nach 1monat testen kann ich sagen, alle Stifte sind noch Heile :)Dadurch, dass hier ein Anspitzer bei war, lassen sich die Stifte prima wieder in die Ursprungsform bringen und die Kinder k√∂nnen wieder weiter malen.Hier jedoch das , warum ich einen Stern abgezogen habe: Vorsicht bei dem roten Stift an der FensterfrontDas Gummi am Fenster ist beim abwischen etwas rosa geworden und ich habe es noch nicht wegbekommen. prod_name: Royal & Langnickel sketching artist pencils - set of 12 drawing pencils 5H to 6B
title: Good for starters
review: I'm really glad I made the investment for real artist pencils, having the different varieties of darkness has helped me a lot in the last couple months since I got them.  I don't do that full greyscale shading stuff, barely breaking ground into general shading, no way I can do that.  But it makes it a lot easier for my drawings because instead of how I did it before where I would just try to draw the basic shapes and general outline with pencil, usually mechanical, lightly and then as I went, each new "layer" would be slightly darker with the permanent stuff that I would trace over with pen as the darkest, but then when I inked the drawing, let the ink dry, and go back to erase before coloring, it was often very difficult to get rid of all the pencil lines because of how hard and dark I had to go with some of them.  But now with these artist pencils, I lightly do the basic shapes with the lightest pencil, and as I go up in "layers" I go one or two pencils up for a darker line with minimal effort amd barely any pressure.  The result is a group of line in varying degrees of darkness that can still be easily erased once I have inked the final outline and I don't have pesky persistent lines and pressure spots showing through my color.  PLUS because you are using multiple pencils per drawing, they last a lot longer before needing to be sharpened.  The one I used most, the 5H, lasted almost two full months before needing to be sharpened and I still haven't sharpened any of the others.  My only beef is a cpuple of them have one spot on the led where it's kind of scratchy and instead of gliding over the paper I can feel it catching.  These are a good set for a starter or someone who doesn't intend to do full greyscale art like me, I doubt I will ever need to move up to a larger or higher end set than this one.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 27 February 2020

prod_name: Royal & Langnickel sketching artist pencils - set of 12 drawing pencils 5H to 6B
title: Not enough tone difference between the H's and the B's
review: I had high hopes for this set of pencils, because it contained several pencils that I havent had in previous pencil sets - i think the darkest I've had was a 2B or 4B? And these went up to 6B - and I like how the B pencils get much softer and darker the farther down their scale you go. Unfortunately, though, there wasnt an extremely noticeable difference from the 6H all the way through to the 6B in this particular set of pencils. I need the softer darker pencils to be very blendable, and these just weren't. I made a chart where I colored a square using each pencil, in order, using the same amount of pressure in each one. There really wasnt a big difference. Then I tried to shade over the squares to see if the blended or smudged well, and you could still see all of the pencil hashmarks. On EVERY SINGLE ONE. I dont expect the H's to blend barely at all, but the hashmarks on all of the B's should have at least started to smudge. The way I draw consists mainly of shading and tone differences, ranging from really light to really dark pitch black.  I mostly use a stump to blend all of it together, and take turns alternating between my stump and my kneaded eraser to do the actual drawing, to bring out the highlights and deepen the shadows. These pencils just dont vary enough in the hardness for me. I'm going to keep them, though, because I just dont feel like going through the trouble to send them back just to get my five bucks back. I can always write letters with them, right?
date: Reviewed in the United States on 9 February 2020

prod_name: Royal & Langnickel sketching artist pencils - set of 12 drawing pencils 5H to 6B
title: Great value pencils but the plastic sleeve is really annoying
review: I'm definitely no artist and I haven't even done any sketching in well over ten years but I was keen to jump back in. I remember I used to like 2B pencils, but I thought I'd grab a mixed pack and try to gauge how they all lay down. The quality seems great for the cost, they're pre-sharpened. The shaft seems to be natural wood so there's some variations in colour of the wood, which adds a little interest more than anything else. The graphite is transfers nicely and isn't too brittle. I quite liked the 2H the 2b and 5b in particular.The only downside is that I find the plastic packaging sleeve bloody awful. It's too fiddly to keep the pencils in to keep them in good condition as the short top flap is very sharp and stiff and tries to dig into the leads as you slide the pencils back in. Can't even seem to get the plastic to accept a fold back in the other direction to get it to stay open.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 October 2018

prod_name: Derwent Academy Watercolour Pencils, Set of 24 in Tin, Multicolour Artist‚Äôs Pencils, Ideal for Wet or Dry Colouring, Drawing & Illustration, Premium Hobbyist Quality, 2300226
title: Good selection of skin tones.
review: A superb set of skin tone colour pencils from Derwent that are student grade and are excellent value for money. They lay down very nicely and blend quite easily. The pencils that have the colour names along the shaft, do have the colour at the base; however, do completely swatch to gain the true hues. The set includes an excellent white - perfect for blending and softening, plus a very good black. The pencils sharpen smoothly without any breakages or splits and are comfortable to hold. Of course, one could always want more colours, but with a little patient layering, a variety of skin tones are achievable. The colours are different to those in the 72 pencil watercolour set, but there are similar colours to be found there, as can be seen with the horizontal comparison bars on the swatch. All round, an excellent starter set before investing in the 72 set, plus a great bonus is that Derwent have a skin tone tutorial page.

prod_name: Derwent Academy Watercolour Pencils, Set of 24 in Tin, Multicolour Artist‚Äôs Pencils, Ideal for Wet or Dry Colouring, Drawing & Illustration, Premium Hobbyist Quality, 2300226
title: Just what I needed for sketching!
review: As a watercolor painter I work out my detailed drawings on tracing paper first and then transfer the drawing to my good watercolor paper. I found a water soluble transfer paper that is a life saver, but I still need to draw faces and hands with very fine lines. Once regular pencil lines are gone over with water, they are sealed and not erasable. Regular graphite water soluble pencils dissolve in water but leave gray washes, which I like for value studies. For my regular work,  these water soluble colored pencils for skin tones are the answer! I can transfer the major part of my image, then finely tune hands and faces, even on small works, and the lines will dissolve.

review: Ho scoperto il marchio Pentel durante un viaggio in Giappone, in cui son rimasto colpito dalla qualit√† dei portamine e delle mine a marchio Pentel.CONFEZIONELe mine arrivano all'interno di un pratico contenitore di plastica blu, di circa 7,5 x 2 cm. In questo modo √® pi√π difficile che la confezione si apra per sbaglio disperdendo le mine ovunque.PRODOTTOLe mine che utilizzo e recensisco sono le HB da 0.5mm, adoperate con un portamine Pentel Graph 1000 CS. Il tratto si presenta deciso e spesso, ma non eccessivamente. La mina √® incredibilmente resistente alla rottura. Ho notato infatti che si rompe meno frequentemente (praticamente mai) rispetto alle mine prodotte da altri marchi, anche molto famosi.Altro valore aggiunto, almeno per me che sono mancino, √® il fatto che il tratto che lascia √® molto pulito, privo di frammenti di mina che potrebbero sporcare mano e foglio scrivendo.PREZZOIl prezzo √® assolutamente concorrenziale con quello di altri marchi, specialmente se rapportato all'eccellente qualit√† di queste mine.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: My new go to pencil!
review: I love the new ARTEZA 120 Color Pencils. I normally use the Prismacolor Color Pencils and was looking to order another set, when I saw the Arteza Color Pencil sets. I went online and checked the reviews of the pencils. There were a lot of good reviews of the Arteza pencils, so I decided to try theme. The price for what I would be getting was very good. Over a 60% savings over the other name brand.Upon receiving and opening the set, I was very surprised at what I had received. It was a well packaged and organized sets of Color pencils. I brought out some of my other older and different brands of pencils for further review. After a series of tests, I can claim that these are on a level equivalent to the Prismacolor pencils. They sharpen and hold a good point and have a lesser series of lead breakage than the others being compared. They have a smooth feel when using and they blend very easily.In purchasing, reviewing and using the Arteza brand Color pencils. I feel that I have made a good choice. I have purchased and used several of their products and they all have presented me with great results. I hope that they continue with the quality and pricing of their products, and I look forward to getting more of the Arteza products for future use in my artworks.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Very good pencils
review: There's so many reasons why I really enjoy these pencils. I didn't start truely loving them until i got Hanna Karlzons books. In my Johanna Basford they worked well, but in Hanna Karlzon books they shine. So like with any pencil, paper matter.When I thought I had filled the tooth of it completly, is till wanted to add more shading i could still add layers of new colors. I find them effortless in blending, everything I have tried in those books.I have also found that you can safely buy from arteza. If there is any kind of problem they will fix it.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Excellent for beginners
review: I‚Äôm not a professional artist, just a beginner who enjoys drawing with coloured pencils. These are really good for my needs, the 72 set has a huge variety of pencils. They‚Äôre very soft and pigmented, for the most part they layer well, but there comes a point when they don‚Äôt accept new layers and the surface can get very waxy. That‚Äôs the only downside, though for a beginner who wants a good quality set that isn‚Äôt too expensive, I think they‚Äôre great quality and value. The pencils keep a point very well so there‚Äôs no need to sharpen them frequently. They‚Äôre sturdy and don‚Äôt break easily. All in all, happy with this purchase.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Great value for money; exceptional set! Definitely better than Prisma's
review: Great customer service (when I had a fault, I contacted them and they resolved it without any dispute!) and really quick delivery (arrived next day!)...The pencils themselves are fantastic. In the past, I've had a set from WHSmith, Marco Raffine's and Prismacolours. This set far easily outstrips them all. The colour range (in the 72 set) is fantastic - couldn't ask for a better range, especially in the reds, pinks and purples that are lacking in some sets! The pencil core is slightly wider than what I've used previously, meaning you don't go through the pencil as quick. The quality of the wax is definitely better than either of the WHSmith or Marco Raffine sets. Prisma's are oil-based and finding these better than prisma's may be personal preference. I like to lay down a lot of colour when I'm colouring (I can be very heavy-handed), and this destroyed my soft-core prismas -- I just blazed through a very expensive set owing to how I colour. If you're like me, and lay a lot of colour down and like really sharp points, then these are a fantastic choice.When it comes to colouring, the blending and layering is equal to prismacolours and better than marco raffine. The wax in the marco raffine, I think, is slightly harder (and lays down a bit scratchy) which is more noticeable after you've used these.If, like me, you now find the market saturated with choices of pencils, pens and colouring book to satiate all colouring enthusiast appetites, you won't go wrong with this set. I did hesitate at first, owing to the cost and being not sure of the quality; however, you really won't be disappointed. The colours are bright, there's a brilliant range, they blend and layer really well, and are great value for your hard-earned income with excellent customer service: what more could you ask for from a set of pencils?

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: very vivid blendable pencils - pretty good cost to performance ratio
review: i like to draw - it gives me a feeling of great satisfaction and pride as well as i really like getting into that "zone" drawing for 6-8 hours at a time - although i am not an artist by any means of the word.  i do not have any real techniques and i use references quite a bit.  so i just do it for fun and sometimes it comes out ok and sometimes not but the idea is to have fun.in these 3 years or so i have come to own Sargent, Marco Raffine (72), FC Polychromos (120), and recently Arteza (72), Prismacolor premier (72) which i have yet to use.the pencils came in a tin stacked with plastic 3 plastic trays - the tin is wrapped in a thin plastic bag.  when i received my pencils some of the pencils came loose and the tin cover was slightly opened - nothing appeared to be broken.the pencils have very vivid colors and sharpen very well - they do come to a very sharp point - however i have a habit of pressing too hard and the sharp point sometimes crumbles from my  heavy handedness.i was able to try out the pencils over the weekend and i broke them in with a picture of St Basils Cathedral in Moscow, Russia.they blend fairly well - i am lazy so i do not use solvents but then again i do not have experience with solvents.  i used the prismacolor premier colorless blender.i have attached my drawing - i look forward to using these pencils again.10-24-20 update. I am ramping up my production because I need to fill up my sketchbook of 100 sheets (canson universal) - this is my goal.I find that arteza colored pencils are great to work with. I think the colors are fantastic- prismacolor premier is creamier than these but these are great to work with too.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Great colored pencils
review: For me, not an artist at all,but love to color and make beautiful things.These colored pencils are great. They are super smooth and soft and they blend super!I had a problem with 3 pencils were the leads broke everytime i sharpened them,  i messaged and asked Arteza if they could send me the 3 colors, but they refund me the total costst of the 72 pencils, which is GREAT service!I now ordered the 120 pencils, more colors to come  ü•∞ü•∞ü•∞I recommend these pencils for people who love to color in adult coloring books

title: Mucho mejor de lo que imaginaba.
review: Francamente, muy buenos.Me han sorprendido muchisimo, tienen base cera, muy buena pigmentaci√≥n, mezclan estupendamente, los colores son luminosos, y cuando los utilizas son muy suaves. Los colores tienen nombre, es decir, a uno de los verdes lo llaman matcha o absenta, es muy original, y tienen grabados unas estrellitas que indican la resistencia del color a la exposici√≥n solar, para mi muy √∫til.Puedes sacar punta perfectamente, no como ocurre con otros "de tan buena fama" que hay veces que te desespera poder afilarlos m√≠nimamente. (en fin lo de siempre, cria fama...)He alucionado al leer, los titulos de algunas valoraciones, diciendo que no los recomiendan por el tema de la cajita o las bandejas, en lugar de valorar el l√°piz en s√≠, tema que a mi francamente me es indiferente, ya que siempre acabo guardando mis colores, en un estuche de tela enrollable, mucho m√°s pr√°ctico para mi.La caja es de metal, con cierre de visagra y las bandejas son de plastico, normal.En definitiva, s√≠, son equiparables a los prisma, por no decir mejores, y en definitiva el precio es fantastico. No puedo opinar en relaci√≥n a los caran d'ache, porque no los he utilizado. Con respecto a los Faber, √©stos son base aceite, Arteza base cera, los noto diferentes por este motivo, por lo tanto no valoro, es cuesti√≥n de gustos.Lo que s√≠ me fastidia un poco es que no puedas comprar los colores individualmente, pero...Sin duda, la pr√≥xima vez, compro la caja de 120.Que quede claro, que mi valoraci√≥n (por los a√±os que llevo pintando y dibujando utilizando diferentes t√©cnicas),  es sincera para ayudar a futuros compradores, al igual que yo obtuve ayuda al leer otros comentarios. (Arteza no me ha pagado por dar mi valoraci√≥n). Un saludo.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 10 November 2021

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: A joy to draw and colour with them !
review: There is nothing to dislike about this pencils .  They layer beautiful , are soft core but can hold a fine point and they DON‚ÄôT crumble ! Arteza colouring pencils are always highly pigmented , I owe also the old 72 count pencil set with smaller cores, this 120set goes a step further , 4mm cores !  You have every colour you will ever need in the beautiful Owl box , my only regret are those horribly flimsy plastic trays. There are 5 of them , colour swatches are on the bottom of the box and inside the hinged cover with names and numbers .  The pencil have on them self their name ,number  & COLOUR FASTNESS . The paint on the pencils is quite correct with the cores . The names ,I wonder who find them in the team ......KOALA GREY, COYOTE BROWN, MARMALADE ORANGE , FRUIT PUNCH , PEACHES AND CREAM  AND  NOW ONE OF MY FAVOURITES :  UNICORN PURPLE !!!  There is not one split pencil in the set.  I had a slight problem with my first set , the Customer care is second to none !  The next day was a brand new perfect set delivered !  I contacted the Arteza team by e-mail and in minutes they responded in minutes. Without any fuss or faff the wanted just my address ,where to send a new set .I owe also smaller sets of polychromos they are without a doubt good pencils , but not for me .  I  prefer how Artezas behave , and also price wise Polys are about ¬£ 157 and Artesas ¬£60 . Both are 120 count . I‚Äôm not an artist , but I like drawing and colouring . I was hesitating to buy the big Arteza set because I owe at least twelve big sets from all around the world , but my prefered pencils are Arteza , if possible I would give 10 stars to the pencils & 10 stars to the Arteza Customer Service !!! Thank you ARTEZA for Your beautiful products and Your exceptional Customer Care !

review: Tengo bastante l√°pices de distintas marcas, mas profesionales y no tanto. Soy dibujante y me gustan probar cosas nuevas como l√°pices sobre todo. He o√≠do sobre la marca Arteza diferentes opiniones y me decid√≠ arriesgarme adquiriendo una lata de 72 l√°pices porque  costaba 0,51‚Ç¨ / unidad.La lata es muy bonita y compacta, parece ser durable. Los l√°pices est√°n puestos en 3 pisos y sobre la tapa de la lata por dentro est√° la carta de los colores(72) puestos con sus n√∫meros, el nombre en ingl√©s y el rango de resistencia a la luz. En general son blandos, los colores son bonitos aunque haya seg√∫n mi opini√≥n muchas rosas y no son para aquellos a quienes gustan colores neutros.  Las minas son resistentes y pone que miden 4mm.  Para papel blanco est√°n adecuados(hice mi carta de colores sobre papel color natural(sketchbook de la marca Hahnem√ºhle con gramaje de 140g/m¬≤). He podido hacer dos capas en general y no estoy muy satisfecho . Esta escrito que se pueden usar tambi√©n  para el papel negro, por esto hice la prueba( 4ta foto) y me qued√© decepcionado porque no sale como en la foto que ha puesto la marca(hice prueba sobre papel color negro de Talens(Black sketchbook de 140g/m¬≤). Sobre todo los amarillos y rojos se ven fatal!  As√≠ que no lo recomiendo(dibujar sobre papel negro). Adem√°s la mayor√≠a de los colores de los l√°pices no coinciden con el color de su tinta(ejemplo fuerte el color Coral/A203/!). Te salvan los n√∫meros en este caso.No me qued√≥ claro la resistencia a la luz, ¬øC√≥mo esta hecha? Y porque estos l√°pices son profesionales, tampoco. Probablemente por esa raz√≥n(resistencia a la luz).En dos palabras: los l√°pices no son malos, al rev√©s, (tienen buen pigmento) pero sirven para trabajos no profesionales y si no se quiere gastar una fortuna. Aunque seria mejor que cuesten menos.Han llegado r√°pido y en buenas condiciones.

review: Tout d'abord je suis ravie pour le prix car j'ai attendu une offre promo tr√®s int√©ressante (autour  de 23 euros ce qui pour la qualit√© des crayons les vaut tr√®s bien). Cela faisait longtemps que je les voulais, car j'ai une grande collection de crayons de couleur (Prisma, Polychromos, Guang Hui, Caran d'Ache, Giotto etc....) et j'avais eu de bons √©chos sur les r√©seaux sociaux en coloriage art th√©rapie, √† un moment donn√© (tr√®s vite d'autres marques prennent le relais d'actualit√©).Perso, j'aime l'esth√©tique des crayons d√©j√† (tr√®s beau) ils sont num√©rot√©s (bon pour ma part j'utilise pas de nuancier donc..) et alors l'odeur est  √† tomb√©. Elle a une odeur de beurre de cacao, quelque chose de gourmand et d'assez fort (c'est tr√®s ent√™tant on aime ou pas perso j'adore, car je supporte pas les odeurs chimiques...). C'est une odeur proche des Prisma mais en plus fort je dirais, et perso, moi √ßa me transporte quand je colorie ;)J'ai commenc√© √† colorier sur un colo, mais aussi test√© sur feuille blanche, une sensation assez grasse glissante proche des Prisma dans la sensation de coloriage (je me permettrais pas de comparer sur la qualit√©, car les Prisma niveau pigmentation et qualit√© sont biens√ªrs au dessus), une sensation tr√®s confortable agr√©able, et plus facile je trouve que les crayons plus secs avec une pigmentation aussi bonne (apr√®s question de go√ªt).J'ai trouv√© quand m√™me des traits communs aux Prisma plus que dans d'autres marques.Maintenant, l√† o√π je suis un peu d√©√ßu c'est le choix des couleurs (trop de vert notamment...) et avec quasi dans chaque tonalit√© de couleurs 2 couleurs quasi identiques  (pas d√©celable sur la couleur des crayons ne correspondant pas du tout √† la r√©alit√© des couleurs une fois colori√© ). C'est une marque int√©ressante et de bonne qualit√© bon rapport qualit√© prix (j'ai aussi les feutres que j'aime bien mais moins aussi pour le choix des couleurs...), m√™me si vous trouverez encore mieux pour ce prix avec plus de crayons, pour ma part, ceux qui aiment le c√¥t√© gras des Prisma mais que vous ne pouvez pas vous offrir dans l'imm√©diat, c'est int√©ressant, et ou pour compl√©ter ces gammes de crayons.Nul part il est indiqu√© qu'ils sont √† la cire mais pour ma part je pense que oui, car ils correspondent en tout point √† la sensation de glisser et gras que l'on peut avoir avec et que j'aime tant.Une gamme √† compl√©ter pour des amoureux des crayons et ou tr√®s bien pour commencer...

review: I was so excited when I got these coloured pencils, the packaging along with the pencils themselves are beautiful made. They colour amazing, the colours are very rich and they feel great using them. However, they sharpen horribly. Every time I'd sharpen them they would break, you have to be very careful and still they are fragile. I've been using these not even three months and already I have little stubby pencils. My other good pencil crayons lasted me years. Disappointed because they are beautiful and I enjoy usuing them, just sharpening them would stress me out!

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Lovely wax-based coloured pencils
review: These pencils are perfect for using in adult colouring books and for hobby artists. The pencil colours adhere to the paper well, they sharpen well, although they are quite soft so don't stay sharp for long. Very good range of colours that blend nicely; not quite as well as very high-end pencils such as Polychromos (oil based), but still very good.Like all wax-based coloured pencils, miniscule bits of the nib break off while colouring. To avoid these tiny bits smudging your work, avoid using your hand to sweep them away. A soft brush is better. Minor smudges are easily removed with an eraser - I use a Faber-Castell eraser pencil. I wouldn't recommend using an electric eraser on these Arteza pencils as in my experience it's more likely to smudge than erase. I imagine that's due to a combination of the wax pencil and the plasticy type of eraser my electric eraser uses.These pencils are the Arteza Expert range, which appears to be their top-level range. I also have a small set of the Arteza Premium range, which are also very nice to use. I don't notice much difference between the two ranges, apart from the barrel shape: round (expert) versus triangular (premium).I think the normal price, which is in the low-¬£40 region, is very good value for the number and quality of the pencils in this set. I was lucky enough to buy on a Black Friday deal, so it was even better value.The Arteza customer services is really helpful and polite. I contacted them with a query and they replied within a few hours, and sent a replacement for a faulty pencil the following day. Best customer service I've ever had from a company on Amazon.
date: Reviewed in the Netherlands on 1 May 2022

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Prisma Beware!
review: I have a lot of colored pencils, from Dollar Store types to high-dollar European brands, but I can't resist checking out every new one I trip over, hoping for the best. Sometimes it pays off, and this is such a time. At the price, I was expecting something less than Marco or Colore quality. Instead, thus far the Arteza Expert is much like Prismacolor, specifically the Prismas I used to get back in the 1960s. Arteza has a little harder core and so requires a bit more aggressive touch. Both are wax-based, with both name and number on the barrel, but Arteza also indicates color-fastness, which is largely exceptional. The Prisma is maybe three-tenths of a millimeter larger diameter. Personally, I have not experienced the breakage problem with Prisma some people have, and am having none with these. They didn't seem to be very blendable at first, but some odorless thinner kicks them in the direction of oil painting. I tried intermixing with Prisma as a test and found it doable, if a bit tricky, yielding a look different from either. Overall, I am delighted with this find, enough so that I am going to order the 72 set as soon as I finish this review. I suspect they will get pricier when more people discover them.  Quick follow-up- The 72 set had a strong paint odor when I opened it, probably from being packaged immediately after the barrels were painted. The smell is fading fast once they are exposed to air to finish curing.

There is an ‚Äúfluorescent yellow ‚Äú pencil, but that‚Äôs not the case. It a lime yellow. 3. There are (for me) too much grays (14 shades, not including the two ‚Äúblacks‚Äù and silver). I preferred less grays and more other colors, specially pastels. Indeed, the price is a bit expensive in my country (because of the import taxes). title: Ottima qualit√† a un giusto prezzo
review: Per prima cosa Amazon merita tutti i miei migliori complimenti, ho ordinato i pencils Arteza e sono arrivati il giorno dopo! √à incredibile considerando che abito in un luogo sperduto della Puglia.I colored pencils Arteza, che dire, sono arrivati in condizioni eccellenti, la prima cosa che mi ha colpito dopo aver aperto la scatola di latta √® stato l'odore di legno vero, legno fresco mescolato a quello dei pigmenti delle matite WOW!Il rapporto qualit√† prezzo √® molto onesto, il fatto che estrarre ogni volta i colori dalle vaschette impilate le une sulle altre √® un po' noiosetta come attivit√†, ma non √® un problema insuperabile.Ammetto che ero scettico durante l'acquisto, non conoscendoli mi sono fatto ingolosire dall'ottimo prezzo.Come si comportano questi colori sulla carta? Direi che mi hanno sorpreso, i colori sono a base cerosa, anche se ho il sospetto che ci sia una piccola quantit√† di base oleosa, perch√© non fa la patina tipica di questi colori (a meno che uno non lo voglia come effetto ci passa sopra un po' di bianco).Sfuma bene, si possono sovrapporre molti strati di colore se si usa una carta mediamente ruvida, io uso la Canson, e anche quando la carta √® ormai saturata di colore se ne pu√≤ aggiungere dell'altro! Ed √® questo il punto a favore che mi ha fatto abbandonare ogni scetticismo.A scanso di equivoci, il bianco non copre i colori, se avete necessit√† di ottenere punti luce procuratevi dei bianchi speciali perch√© tanto √® inutile sono poche le marche di colore che hanno il bianco che si impone sulle altre campiture.Per il resto i colori sono molto vividi, luminosi, adatti a stili pop ma sorprendono molto anche con il classicismo.Li consiglio per studenti e professionisti, sono un ottimo strumento, migliori di tante altre marche super blasonate.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Great pencils at a great price.
review: Just received these pencils and I have to say I'm super impressed with their quality.  They arrived in pristine condition, safely nestled in their tin case within a cardboard sleeve and packed carefully in their shipping box.  I have many other brands of pencils in my collection, including Prismacolor Premiers and Faber Castell Polychromos and after testing these pencils, I can say they definitely hold their own against brands that cost a great deal more!  In appearance, they remind me a lot of Polychromos, with fully lacquered barrels in the colour of the lead and dipped ends.  The core is 4.5 mm thick so I expect these pencils will be quite durable.  Every pencil arrived in perfect condition, no cracked cores, no nicks or imperfections to be found.  They hold their points well, and don't crumble and break like Prismacolors often do.  The colour lay down is pretty effortless, they layer well, and the pencils are highly pigmented.  All in all, I'm VERY happy with my purchase and won't hesitate to purchase more Arteza pencils in the future.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 10 January 2020

Was die Farbbest√§ndigkeit angeht, kann ich leider auch noch nichts sagen).Die Stifte haben reichlich Pigmente und sind Wachsbasiert, daher auch nicht mit Wasser verwischbar (Daf√ºr gibt es die Aquarellstifte :-))Die Farbe l√§√üt sich auch mit leichtem Druck auf's Papier bringen (Ok, bei manchen Stiften einfacher als bei anderen)F√ºr mich sind sie eine passende Erg√§nzung zu meinen anderen Stiften, da auch ein paar aussergew√∂hnliche Farben dabei sind.Zu diesem Preis kann ich die Stifte nur weiterempfehlen.Noch ein Tipp am Rande, auf YouTube gibt es K√ºnstlerInnen, die diese Stifte genauer unter die Lupe nehmen und wirklich gute Bilder damit zeichnen.LG

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: creamy smooth quality pencils for all artistic levels
review: These are quality pencils and the packaging is great, the metal tin keeps them secure. That‚Äôs a huge plus...So, I‚Äôve used and own several brands of colored pencils, I‚Äôm not a professional artist.Although something went terribly wrong on my order and it took a long time to arrive originally was to arrive on 4th but arrived on evening of the 7th.. being a prime item and was promised delivery on 4th- that did bother me & chat was zero help.I want to specify Amazon chat not arteza.So shipping issues need to be approved on.ON THE PRODUCT NOW:)Worth the purchase-but price is a bit inflated in my opinion.Arteza should rethink this increase on price.Myself -if it continues to increase as it currently has been I won‚Äôt buy again. I‚Äôm partial to PRISMA, however,These are softer than most other WAX pencils on the market other than PRISMA premier. Thus giving Arteza an edge above others on sheerness and layering ability.These are quality I will give 5 stars on that.I noticed that some of the darker colors do tend to be harder leads and thus blending the darker ones lessens.They are a smoother lay down than other comparable brands.DO NOT confuse these with oil based or watercolor pencils as those are different and lay down differently. Arteza has watercolor pencils as well. Make sure you order correct as I have made that error üòÇThese are wax based.I‚Äôve compared several brands to these and these are more like PRISMA than other brands.If I were comparing these wax based to an oil based pencil, Castle arts oil based run a close second in smoothness.. for an oil base brand.Anyhow, back to Arteza üòçThe blunting of the tips I think is to prevent breaking during shipping so you‚Äôll want to hone the tips by using them or a quick  mini turn in a sharpener will remedy it.I had no issue using my hand sharpener to do it, onlyTook one turn to achieve a point.These are harder leads BUT SOFT LET ME BE CLEAR THESE ARE VERY NICE CREAMY PENCILS and less breaking is a good quality on any pencil.So all In all these are worth the purchase for quality, blending and color ability.The colors are PHENOMENAL I love they differ in all aspects as they add more choices to my collection. So, you will be happy with these...Price point I‚Äôd definitely say is good but the recent increases has me a bit cranky.. I‚Äôd rate these around a 50-60.00 dollar USD for the 120 set. 80.00 seems a tad HIGH.But I‚Äôm not judging just one person‚Äôs opinion üòçYou can‚Äôt go wrong purchasing these though, any artist expert or beginner would find these workable and desirable.I tried to purchase the 120 set as it was prime item and delivery was next day, however once order was placed it said it would be 5 days so that upset me and I cancelled it because that shouldn‚Äôt be happening on prime delivery items.I was very dissatisfied with that aspect and I couldn‚Äôt get a straight answer from Amazon.As I won‚Äôt let that reflect my product option üòéThat issue shouldn‚Äôt really be sellers fault, I was bummed that I wasn‚Äôt able to get my 120 set as promised right now. But maybe I‚Äôll try again in the future because these are EXCELLENT pencils.So if you need them ASAP ask about arrival time from Amazon I‚Äôm not sure if it‚Äôs due to holidays but it was upsetting I ordered them specifically because I was getting next day PRIME delivery And didn‚Äôt..And it‚Äôs unfortunate there seems to be some discrepancy on shipping.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Fantastic pencil crayons
review: Absolutely amazing pencil crayons.Packaged and presented beautifully in a metal tin box. Each layer has 24 different shades of colours. Each true to its shade.Each colour blends perfectly. I love the way these work. The more you play with them the better techniques you find too. I found many ways to work with them once I started playing around.On different styles of paper and card you can get different effects. Its worth trying each to find your favourite to work with. My favourite being on the card in the picture above. They also work well on canvas card and watercolour card.These leave a stunning shine to the colours. No lines at all left behind, all blended well and they're smooth on most types of card.The pencils are very nice to work with. They do not scratch the paper, they're smooth and creamy and glide across the paper/card. The colour comes out really strong whether using it lightly or pressing harder for shading.I'm no artist, I love the draw and I get through pencil crayons quite quickly so I needed to find some good quality ones.Now these are creamy as I said, when doing deep colouring you can use up more pencil than you want to. I would prefer this and have a smooth colouring journey than cheaper pencils that do not give enough colour and leave lines behind!I did have an issue with my first box, the leads were broken within the crayons so when I was sharpening, they were falling out mostly. After speaking to arteza customer service via email, I received fantastic support and was sent a new pack straight away. My second pack has no issues.I would definitely recommend these pencil crayons. They really are amazing quality. True to colour. Work in many different ways. Brilliant customer service too.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Arteza est devenue une marque de r√©f√©rence !
review: Je fais du coloriage pour adultes et je colorie quasi qu'aux crayons de couleur, et de ce fait j'en ai pas mal.Je coloris aussi bien aux prismacolors qu'aux polychromos ou alors aux pablos de chez caran d'ache.Mais alors l√†, je suis surprise par la qualit√© de ces crayons effectivement ils font penser √† de vrais crayons professionnelles.Les couleurs se m√©langent bien entre elles, belles pigmentations des mines, les crayons sont num√©rot√©s, se taille tr√®s bien avec le taille crayon √† manivelle le Dahle 133,  je regrette seulement qu'il n'y en a que 72 tout comme les crayons aquarellables de la m√™me marque et qu'on ne peut pas les trouver √† l'unit√© car alors franchement √ßa serait top !Alors n'h√©sitez pas √† prendre ces crayons de couleurs que vous soyez d√©butants ou confirm√©s en coloriage ou en dessins, vous ne serez pas d√©√ßus !Excellent rapport qualit√© prix !Je recommande +++
date: Reviewed in the United States on 7 December 2020

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: A Very Good Set with Caveats
review: First off this would be an excellent budget set for a child, or an adult who needs to buy budget priced pencils for their coloring books.  For those purposes I would highly recommend them.  The color choice in the 72 set is excellent, though some could use more depth in shade and I wish there were a really dark inky blue color, however this set is more than enough to blend and get colors you want.  They are very soft in lay down and sharpen to a nice point which does not easily break as some brands do.  They layer and blend reasonably well though not as good as my Polychromos do but I did not expect that at this price point.  I love some of the colors, the pinks and purples and greens are well represented.  The big downside to sets like this is that you cannot buy individual pencils when one wears out, this is a huge disadvantage to someone like myself.  I like to be able to buy only the colors I use the most as often as I need to without buying a whole set.  I got this set for travel purposes, and it will be great for that.  It comes beautifully packaged in a metal tin with 3 layers.  The metal tin is covered in cellophane and then put into a sturdy form fitting box and then shipped in the Amazon box.  Because of this the pencils arrived in one piece with no damage.  Kudos for the packaging.  I can certainly recommend these pencils and they would be great for anyone starting out or who does not want to spend a fortune.  All in all a very good buy and I do not think you will be disappointed as long as you understand these are not the same as Polychromos, or Pablo's or other high end brands.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: I‚Äôm satisfied with customer service.
review: The set I got had blending and water-solubility issues. As they are, I‚Äôd categorize my set as a craft-level set, not a professional-level set. Nice pigmentation but limited usage (yes to coloring and cardmaking, no to blending gradients or multimedia work). Annoyingly, water doesn‚Äôt move it enough to use as watercolor pencils, but it moves it enough to smear the artwork. I‚Äôve never been able to get a nice dry blend from watercolor pencils, which must have been the accidental mix-up that happened here (I think they crossed formulas accidentally). I have received a refund, Arteza has good customer service. But they also said they aren‚Äôt sure when the issue will be fully solved, so maybe don‚Äôt order these pencils for a while just to be save. I am satisfied with their customer service. I will have to reorder these maybe next birthday.The 72 set currently is on sale enough to make it crafting-level pricing, if you‚Äôre a crafter with no need for blending/gradients and water-related uses (multimedia, resist, use both sides of the paper). The 120 set is a bit pricy for craft-level supplies as of yet, for the specific set I received. There have been some awesome reviews, over years, so it‚Äôs probably just the one batch. Still, buyer beware. But great customer service.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 July 2023

prod_name: Pentel Arts Watercolour Pencil Set - Assorted, 24 Count (Pack of 1)
title: These are amazing.
review: I've never used watercolour pencils before, bought these on a whim because they were an incredibly low price.Well, these exceeded my expectations. They behave just like watercolours, except better. You can get very fine detail with these, they blend wonderfully, and - what I'm happiest with - they are perfect for creating a base sketch without risking smudging, or visible linework, like you get when using pencil/graphite.This set is a great intro to watercolour pencils, and probably a great set for an intermediate watercolourist as well.  I highly recommend these.

prod_name: Pentel Arts Watercolour Pencil Set - Assorted, 24 Count (Pack of 1)
title: Pencil Power!
review: These pencils are excellent!Great value and perform well.They are not magic pencils, so if you can‚Äôt draw they won‚Äôt help. However, whatever your skills, the colours will look vivid and pleasing to the eye, even if your dogs dinner of artwork attempts are causing people to spit their tea out when you show them.Buy these pencils, they are marvellous!

Los he usado en libros para colorear y te aceptan dos o tres capas en ese tipo de papel (bristol), lo que me gusta porque con acuarelas de pastilla o tubo la hoja se pone muy rugosa por tanta agua, en cambio con los l√°pices tengo m√°s control. En papel de acuarela de 300 g tambi√©n acepta algunas capas y puedes detallar el dibujo con otro tipo de l√°pices. Para activarlos uso el pincel con dep√≥sito de agua que ya ten√≠a de la misma marca y la verdad es que me funciona muy bien. Los colores se vuelven vibrantes al contacto con el agua, sin necesidad de aplicar demasiado pigmento ni demasiada agua. Son un muy buen regalo para gente creativa. prod_name: STAEDTLER 100 G12 S Mars Lumograph Graphite Pencils for Drawing & Sketching - Assorted Degrees, 8B-2H (Tin of 12)
title: Exceptional Quality for Sketching Enthusiasts
review: The Lumograph STAEDTLER Graphite Sketch Pencil is a true gem for anyone passionate about sketching or drawing. I've been using these pencils for a while now, and they consistently deliver outstanding results.First and foremost, the quality of the graphite is exceptional. The lead is smooth, allowing for effortless strokes and precise lines. Whether I'm working on intricate details or shading larger areas, these pencils provide the control and versatility I need.The range of hardness available in the set is perfect for various sketching techniques. From the soft and buttery feel of the 8B for darker shades to the crisp lines achievable with the 2H, these pencils cover the spectrum beautifully. The consistent quality across the entire range ensures a seamless transition between different hardness levels.The pencil's minimalistic design and the vibrant blue hue make it visually appealing, which is an added bonus for those who appreciate aesthetics in their art tools.In conclusion, the Lumograph STAEDTLER Graphite Sketch Pencil is a top-tier choice for sketching enthusiasts. The quality, range, and durability make them a staple in my sketching toolkit. If you're serious about your art and demand the best from your pencils, these are an absolute must-try. Five stars without a doubt!

review: Ho acquistato queste matite Mars Lumograph Black perch√© ero rimasto molto contento della grafite 8B della stessa marca, contenuta nell'ottimo set da 12 Mars Lumograph "normali", anch'esso in vendita su Amazon.In effetti, questa grafite Mars Lumograph 8B √® particolarissima. Molto nera e quasi "grassa", √® poco cancellabile come se fosse una matita colorata ed in breve √® diventata la mia preferita (allego la palette dell'intero set, a lato di un piccolo bozzetto che feci tempo fa per esemplificare l'uso delle varie gradazioni di grafite).√à allora che sono venuto a conoscenza di questo nuovo tipo di matite della Staedtler, sempre Mars Lumograph ma di tipo "Black", anch'esse in grafite ma di colore molto pi√π nero del normale per la presenza di una pi√π alta percentuale di carbone; vedendole in vendita qui su Amazon, le ho acquistate per curiosit√†.Fatta esclusione per la 8B del set Mars Lumograph "normale" che √® del tutto simile con la 8B di tipo "Black", le altre gradazioni non sono da confondere per√≤, in quanto a resa grafica, n√© con quelle in normale grafite n√© con le matite a carboncino.Delle prime non hanno quei fastidiosi riflessi lucidi avendo una finitura opaca, e delle seconde non possiedono la friabilit√† propria del carbone.Sono pastose e poco cancellabili come se fossero delle matite colorate nere, ma a differenza di queste sono sfumabili anche con le dita, hanno una mina resistentissima e molto affilabile, e soprattutto sono di quattro gradazioni diverse: la confezione comprende due matite di gradazione 2B, due 4B, una 6B e una 8B.Io le uso spesso e con piacere perch√© queste matite Black consentono agli amanti di questo tipo di tecnica, semplicemente ripassando un sottile strato sulle zone fatte con la grafite normale dove si vuole che sia reso un nero pi√π profondo, di attenuare anche l'effetto lucido tipico della grafite.Queste Mars Lumograph Black sono un complemento anche per chi ama disegnare con il carboncino: le rifiniture, i particolari e le ombre pi√π scure possono essere aggiunte con profitto dopo la stesura del fissatore ottenendo risultati molto convincenti.Allego tra le immagini il confronto tra la matita Lumograph in normale grafite di gradazione 8B e la sua "gemella" 8B Lumograph Black: entrambe hanno la mina di diametro maggiore delle altre gradazioni: ben 4,5 mm., mentre per le Black 6B, 4B e 2B il diametro √® di 3,6.Le Mars Lumograph Black sono contenute in una pratica scatola metallica con una funzionale cerniera apribile (molto comoda per coloro che disegnano sovente anche all'aperto o in altre svariate condizioni ambientali), ed inoltre, al di l√† dell'abituale eleganza, riportano intelligentemente su ognuna delle sei facce la gradazione (caratteristica comodissima per un disegnatore).Consiglio a tutti gli appassionati di disegno, professionisti e non, l'acquisto delle Lumograph black, perch√© la resa √® in definitiva qualcosa di diverso: diverso dalle grafiti, diverso dai carboncini, diverso dalle matite colorate. Si ha un ibrido di cui davvero si sentiva la mancanza a livello grafico.P.S.:Ora che sto scrivendo noto che ne hanno prodotto un kit in cui le matite Lumograph Black sono tutte di gradazioni diverse, avendo aggiunto la HB e la 7B: le acquister√≤ non appena "nanizzate" queste.Spero di esservi stato utile.

prod_name: STAEDTLER 100 G12 S Mars Lumograph Graphite Pencils for Drawing & Sketching - Assorted Degrees, 8B-2H (Tin of 12)
title: Great art pencils
review: The original Staedtler Lumograph 7B (EB) was always my favorite but the 7B & 8B (EE) never quite fit in with the rest of the Lumograph drawing pencils, they were a carbon & graphite mix while the rest of the grades are graphite. Having them split into two lines gives so much more options. They are nice & dark, as dark as Cretacolor Neros & darker than Faber Castell Matte but not as smooth as either, you can feel just a bit of grab on the paper. You can erase but minimally & smudging/blending with stumps or tortillons is also minimal but that helps make sketchbook drawings stay less messy. This is a great & useful addition to any drawing toolkit.

title: Really dark and no shine
review: These pencils are exceptional. They are very black, not grey and leave no graphite shine.I do not use these for skin or shading because they don't blend out well. This isn't necessarily a bad thing. There are parts you don't want to smudge,  like eyelashes.I use caran d'ache grafwood for my skin as they are very soft and blend out well. Not great for detail though. Then I use Faber-Castell pitt matte pencils for most other parts of a drawing.Using all 3 brands enables me to get the best of them all.

prod_name: STAEDTLER 100 G12 S Mars Lumograph Graphite Pencils for Drawing & Sketching - Assorted Degrees, 8B-2H (Tin of 12)
title: Paying a little more is worth it
review: Amazon carries plenty of no-name and budget brand pencil sets, cheap, and they are usually fine. I have bought several without regret. But spending just a few dollars more for a box of Staedtlers is worth it. I do think they sharpen better with less lead breakage and last longer, but that could be me just getting better at sharpening (yes, there is a knack to it). The nicest touch is how the hardness value is imprinted on all six faces of the hexagon, so you can locate the one you want without having to rotate pencils to see the label. I don't know of any other pencil brand that has this. Remember that there are two different 12-packs--this one, which is mostly softer leads, and another that emphasizes the harder ones. Amazon can be overpriced for some art supplies, but not here--this is a very good price for this product compared to art stores and other online sellers. I might stock up!

title: Mejores cuanto m√°s los usas
review: He usado todo tipo de l√°pices 'negros' para los tonos oscuros, desde grafitos de distintas marcas, pasando por carbones normales, comprimidos, grasos, los Cont√© 1720, pasteles negros ... Bien por vaguer√≠a o porque soy demasiado principiante para darme cuenta, voy buscando un tipo de l√°piz que me permita negros intensos, pero que luego no tenga que andar con fijadores para que no se me vaya o se traspase a la hoja de al lado. Los Cont√© igual se acercaban un poco pero siguen manchando all√° por donde pasan.Estos cayeron en mis manos despu√©s de ver varios an√°lisis. Al principio me resultaba algo extra√±a la sensaci√≥n, ya que no son suaves como un grafito, son como una cera dura, pero los resultados me gustaron mucho. Alcanzan negros mucho m√°s intensos que un grafito (aunque el Steadtler normal 8B no est√° nada mal) y no tienes ese brillo del grafito que puede ser molesto. A medida que los usas y te acostumbras vas obteniendo mejores resultados y te van gustando m√°s. Se quedan bastante bien en el papel, no difuminan mal, no manchan ni necesitan de fijador. La cajita donde vienen en un buen detalle y el precio por 6 l√°pices est√° muy bien.Un excelente producto que va a gustar a los amantes del dibujo a l√°piz.

prod_name: STAEDTLER 100 G12 S Mars Lumograph Graphite Pencils for Drawing & Sketching - Assorted Degrees, 8B-2H (Tin of 12)
title: Iconic pencil
review: These are excellent premium quality pencils by Staedtler for sketching. There are 12 x 8mm pencils in total ranging from 2H to 8B. The degrees of softness are: 2H, H, F, HB, B, 2B, 3B, 4B, 5B, 6B, 7B, 8B. They are presented in a nice metal tin which provides good protection and easy access. The highly distinctive blue, silver and black top livery is iconic and it hasn't changed in years.I have used these pencils before and they have never let me down. This set is excellent for building up tone in portrait or landscape sketches for example. They sharpen well without splintering, and are comfortable to hold and use. The graphite is super smooth on paper and does not scratch at all like cheaper pencils. The graphite also erases easily so you can perfect your work. There is something very nice and satisfying about a good quality pencil like this one. This is a great set for any artist or student alike. Recommended.

prod_name: STAEDTLER 100 G12 S Mars Lumograph Graphite Pencils for Drawing & Sketching - Assorted Degrees, 8B-2H (Tin of 12)
title: ‚ÄúThese are real artist grade pencils.‚Äù
review: I hope I‚Äôm not the only one that wanted to see a comparison between these and the Faber Pitt-Matte set. I would first like to say I‚Äôm a fan of both brands but neither is my all time favorite brand, so I sway neither direction in a biased opinion.  So let‚Äôs begin. After a scale hardness check, these pencils were exactly on scale where they are claiming to be. Paint on these pencils are very nice. While holding them, they feel exactly like the regular Lumos. And after a few hours of testing these, I will admit that these are better than the regular Lumograph set, and they are slightly above the faber-9000 series, however, they fall short of being as good as the faber Pitt-Matte set.  Why?  Well they just don‚Äôt have that matte charcoal finish that the Pitt set is able to achieve. I have also did a review on that set if you happen to stumble across it here on Amazon.  Listen, don‚Äôt get me wrong, these pencils are definitely in a serious race here. And could possibly be in the top 5th or 6th place of the best woodcase pencils being made. And I don‚Äôt have to tell you there are thousands of wood case pencil companies. Hundreds of them claiming to be the best artist grade pencils.  If you can make it into the top 10 on my list, your pencils are definitely worth buying. And these Lumo Blacks are definitely on my list. These are the types of pencils that make you want to draw. I know you are not bound down to artistic creativity by tools, however, any artist will tell you, you can only get as good as the tool will let you.  So when you by cheap supplies, your progress will only go so far before you must upgrade to better supplies or your abilities will fall short of your capable talents.  ...A set like this will not only help you achieve better work, but will also make you strive to push them and yourself to higher levels of progression. I definitely suggest buying this set and testing them out for yourself. Or if you are also a collector like myself, add this set into your collection. I always buy 2 sets of every pencil so I will always have a brand new set to put into my massive pencil collection. I hope this review helps out

prod_name: Derwent Drawing Colouring Pencils, Drawing & Writing, Set Of 12, Ideal For Illustrating & Detailing, Professional Quality, 0700671
title: Amazing Colored Pencils!
review: Years ago, I was introduced to Derwent Drawing pencils as part of a promo and received a 6 piece set through an art supply vendor. As a colored pencil artist, I was soon amazed at the quality, pigment and feel of these pencils. I liked them so much that I decided to recently upgrade to the full 24 set and saw that Amazon had a fantastic price.The colors in this set are subtle, beautiful shades that I could not find in other sets of popular pencils.  These pencils are truly the elite artist grade colored pencil, in that they are super creamy/waxy and pigmented and layer flawlessly. Though they appear to be marketed for rendering animals, they are equally impressive for rendering flesh tones, and architectural pieces. They work very well combined with other pencils and layer well with oil-based or wax-based brands. The sensory feel of these cross between a wax- based and oil-based colored pencil but with wider leads. From what I've observed, they leave no wax bloom or excessive residue. The pigments are intense that you can go over several previous layers of colored pencil (other brands) and easily leave rich, broad strokes.  They are perfect for final detailed accents on pieces. The Chinese White pencil in the set is also perfect for highlighting over layers of pencil, and covers well on darker papers.As for being erasable, they will erase to a certain degree on most paper. Though, they do so very well on black, smoother illustration board. They don't erase as well on other papers, but I find that if I apply them over subsequent layers of colored pencil, they erase better.For these pencils, paper choice plays an important role. They are bit too rich and bold for regular sketching/copy paper. I find that they work beautifully on vellum bristol, illustration board and erase especially well on black illustration board. They also hold up well on artist professional grade drawing paper that has a weight of 90lb or more. If you are trying to achieve a smooth finish, I probably wouldn't use these on general sketchbook or heavy, broad toothed paper or you will see a lot of the paper's texture.For the colored pencil artist or those with special interest in drawing, these pencils are very much recommended. They're well made, of excellent quality in durability and lightfast ratings (the colors won't easily fade) and the leads last a long time. *Important: You will need a wider hole pencil sharpener for these. Something metal and durable.The Derwent brand pastel pencil sharper is perfect for these pencils.I cannot say enough good things about these amazing pencils and am fortunate to have acquired the full set!

prod_name: Derwent Drawing Colouring Pencils, Drawing & Writing, Set Of 12, Ideal For Illustrating & Detailing, Professional Quality, 0700671
title: Good selection of colours for drawing
review: I must now have five or six sets of Derwent pencils, but these, the latest are my favourites. They are a selection of browns, muted greens and blues, off whites and other naturalistic colours. For drawing and sketching naturalistic scenes I think they are a clever selection. You can always add others from the range for bright colours, but these bring a sense of understated beauty to your drawings.The pencils themselves are round with thick leads. they are quite soft - similar to Derwent's coloursoft range and do not hold a fine point for very long. I suggest that (1) you keep a good quality pencil sharpener close by and that (2) Derwent consider making a hexagonal finer leaded version for people who want to do detailed drawings.The colours, like most of Derwent's insoluble coloured pencils blend well if you don't put down too much at once. If you really scrub hard you'll end up with a slightly waxy bloom and it's difficult to put more colour on the top and blend the colours. Almost it acts like a wax resist when you try to pencil over, and definitely like a wax resist if you try to water colour over.If I have a problem with these (and for that matter, most coloured pencils) it's the white. It's pretty translucent. Which may be what it should be and maybe what you want. But I would like a white that was really opaque and you could use for highlights.In summary, if you're into naturalistic drawing these are a good selection and deliver; there's a smaller set for the cautious but I'm glad I got the whole 24.
