prod_name: Derwent Drawing Colouring Pencils, Drawing & Writing, Set Of 12, Ideal For Illustrating & Detailing, Professional Quality, 0700671
title: Beautiful Pencils. Gorgeous Saturated Colours, are Creamy and Perfect for Nature.
review: Derwent Drawing Pencils are creamy, rich coloured pencils with a dreamy colour palate suitable for landscapes- nature studies, wildlife studies and portraiture. I had originally purchased the 6 pc set, just to try them out. Due to some of the issues I had experienced with the Coloursoft coloured pencils, I did not want to splurge on these just yet. Almost immediately I fell in love with them. These are richly pigmented, and when creating the swatches I knew I had to upgrade. The colours offered here in the 24 pc set (their largest) are gorgeous, earthy tones, and the performance of these pencils are outstanding. Rich pigments, vibrant colours that layer and blend exquisitely. Like the Coloursoft, and the Artists pencils, these barrels are thick, and the 5mm lead allows for a lot of pigment on that lay-down.The issues are minimal. Price - these are expensive. The prices here on Amazon are the best I was able to find and these pencils are worth the asking price. Another minor negative is the thickness of the pencils may get in the way when colouring in, or drawing the tiny details in your pieces. Also their largest set of 24 colours may be limiting to some, and although the colours offered here are just what‚Äôs needed for nature and animal studies, you may still be yearning for more colour options (as evidenced when drawing the unfinished dog attached. I had to default to the Coloursoft pencils for the tongue's red tones). These are meant to be more of a companion piece to your other Derwent pencils; Coloursoft, Artists, ProColour, so for further colour options, just reach for whatever set you have. Currently I own the Coloursoft (36), Studio (36), and Artists (72). The Drawing pencils are my favourite so far of the Derwent line.Overall, Derwent Drawing Coloured pencils are fantastic. The 24 pc set is what is recommended as you get the full colour palette in a convenient tin. These are my go to pencils whenever I want to draw anything with four legs and is covered in fur, and those soft, dreamy landscapes. Although these may not be the best pencils for colouring books due to their theme specific colour selection, they perform beautifully, laying down gorgeous and saturated colours, and is recommended for artists of all levels.

prod_name: Derwent Drawing Colouring Pencils, Drawing & Writing, Set Of 12, Ideal For Illustrating & Detailing, Professional Quality, 0700671
title: Lovely soft pencils and colours, Earthy and vibrant.
review: The White is great. Really good. Other colours are nice but super smudgey and I can't control the mess that they make on my page. I'm not very professional; At all! Obviously you need to work more carefully and use tracing paper to protect the page from your hand smudging it. In other words, you need to be organised. They are also thick pencils, not so good for detail. Probably better for looser work?

prod_name: Derwent Drawing Colouring Pencils, Drawing & Writing, Set Of 12, Ideal For Illustrating & Detailing, Professional Quality, 0700671
title: interessanti, molto buone!
review: Interessanti matite: tonalit√† particolari, mina ampia e morbida (ma non eccessivamente da consumarsi troppo  velocemente), legno resistente e leggermente pi√π "pesante" rispetto ad altre marche. Facili sovrapposizioni di colori anche con altre marche. Sfumatura facile. Sovrapponendo ciascun colore con il bianco o sfumandolo, il colore muta leggermente, dando la possibilit√† di creare effetti interessanti e molteplici. La mina ampia permette di coprire zone estese con meno passaggi.Pacco arrivato in anticipo, poco "bardato", ma n√© la scatola di metallo n√© le matite stesse presentano segni di danni (ho gi√† temperato diversi pezzi senza riscontrare rotture o simili).All'apertura ho avuto solo un po' di perplessit√† perch√© nella confezione di metallo le matite hanno spazio per "ballare" leggermente, dunque ho avuto timore che, nell'invio o portandole in giro potessero rovinarsi o rompersi le punte.

title: The perfect sketching pencils!!
review: I prefer to sketch and draw with earth tone colors generally, and I‚Äôve had a hard time finding good drawing pencils (as opposed to standard color pencils) in the right tones. These are great! Sanguine, Ruby Earth, and Sepia are EXACTLY what I was looking for. These are smooth, feel great on paper, and most of them are beautifully pigmented. The only ones I found to be a bit waxy and weak on color were Green Shadow and Solway Blue, but those aren‚Äôt ones I‚Äôll probably use a lot so overall this set is perfect!

title: Suaves. Se gastan en seguida.
review: Sacar punta es muy f√°cil aunque gastas medio lapso de una vez, jeje. Es cremoso, y puedes crear capas suaves tomando el l√°piz desde el extremo (eso cuando a√∫n no hayas sacado punta y se quede m√°s y m√°s corto). En general est√°n muy bien, lo que no comprendo es por que se triplica su precio de set de 6 a de 12. Es una barbaridad pasar de 7 a 26 euros para lo que nos van a durar al sacarles punta. De verdad que son tan deliciosos como pueda esperarse de buenos l√°pices, cremosos, vaporosos y vers√°tiles pero esas oscilaciones de precio me parecen lo peor.

prod_name: Derwent Drawing Colouring Pencils, Drawing & Writing, Set Of 12, Ideal For Illustrating & Detailing, Professional Quality, 0700671
title: Wonderful pencils
review: If you draw landscapes or birds and animals you should have this set of pencils.  The colours are perfect for such subjects.The pencils themselves have a comfortable circular barrel, a smooth warm brown varnish and an elegant dipped end showing the colour of the core of the pencil.The core is soft and easy to blend, a slightly waxy texture, it goes onto paper smoothly and shades well with light pressure and gives intense colour with firmer pressure.  The core holds a point nicely - perfect for when drawing fur.Excellent Derwent quality as expected.

prod_name: Derwent Drawing Colouring Pencils, Drawing & Writing, Set Of 12, Ideal For Illustrating & Detailing, Professional Quality, 0700671
title: Softest Coloured Pencils Ever!
review: These pencils are absolutely incredible! They have a fast lay down and blend out with oms very well. The Derwent Drawing Pencils are arguably the softest coloured pencils on the market. They do sometimes break but the quality of the pencils are very good so it doesn‚Äôt happen too often, unlike prismacolor.They come in a muted earthy palette suitable for landscapes, wildlife and portraiture. Because of this they wouldn‚Äôt be a great set to start off with but a set you would purchase once you already have an established coloured pencil set to use along side of them.All of them are highly lightfast with 23 scoring an 8 on the blue wool scale and one scoring a 7.Overall they are an extremely excellent pencil that I would recommend to almost any coloured pencil artist to add to their collection!

prod_name: Derwent Drawing Colouring Pencils, Drawing & Writing, Set Of 12, Ideal For Illustrating & Detailing, Professional Quality, 0700671
title: Great pencils
review: I bought this small set to try these out. They are so good that I bought the 24 set. It's a limited palette, but just enough for portraits and figure studies. I was using another famous brand, but I became disillusioned when I found out that many of their colors are nowhere near permanent. Derwent, although more expensive, provides pencils with highly permanent pigments.This set is very much like one that I would build; mostly earth colors with subdued blues and greens. It's specifically designed for realistic landscapes, plus human and animal portraits.I'll probably get a few spectral colors from the Derwent Coloursoft set.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 July 2011

title: Impressed with the quality

prod_name: Derwent Drawing Colouring Pencils, Drawing & Writing, Set Of 12, Ideal For Illustrating & Detailing, Professional Quality, 0700671
title: wonderful pencils for drawing fur
review: I recently purchased these pencils and I adore them.  I've used them on both pastel paper and bristol board and they worked fine on both.  The white and black in this line are really the best.  The black in this is much darker than my prismacolor black pencil.  These are much softer than prismacolor pencils.  Imagine a combination between prismacolor premier pencils and oil pastels.  I like the smudgy way they blend.  These however are not for everyone.  My prismacolor's hold a point better.  These would be rubbish for detailed adult coloring books because they do not hold a point very well.  People were commenting in the reviews that they liked them for portraits.  I'm a portrait artist and I've done a portrait with them but I didn't love them for that purpose.  They were perfect for drawing furry animals.  I love the color range.  It's really well thought out. Great greys for shadows.  I do not recommend these for lots of tiny detail work, you'll be wasting them sharpening like crazy.  I love these to pieces but will be buying some Faber Castell Polychromos for my most detailed work.Something important to know about these.  They are incredibly lightfast, that's not common for colored pencils.  All but one has the highest lightfast rating of 8 and the one that doesn't is a 7.  This is important to me because I sell my originals and wouldn't want my work to fade on my customers.These work great with my prismacolor pencils so I often use both in the piece.  The nose on the tiger drawing is the only part where I used prismacolor instead because there is no pink in the derwent drawing pencils set.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 27 December 2023

Sono di diametro leggermente pi√π grande delle comuni matite e quindi non entrano in tutti i temperamatite.

Deseaba un rotring para mi coleccion de lapices ya  que soy dibujante y este modelo definitivamente me ha satisfecho . Recomendado si prefiere lapiceros delgados a los gruesos .

title: Quality feel, nice balance and great to write with
review: Seen this on offer and sucummbed to the temptation!  It is pricy but when it is on offer it is ideal.I like Rotring pens/pencils and I find that they are nice to write with.  The only problem I have had with previous pencils is that the nib mechanisim seems to fail with me.  Bit early for this one but I'm hoping the 600 works with no issues and lasts me a long time.The pencil is all metal and has a nice weight/feel to it with the weight more towards the nib.  The gnarled surface at the nib end is just the right size when holding it.  I bought the 0.5mm which I prefer to write with.At the other end it has a rotator selector for different types of lead; 2H, 4H, 2B, B, HB, F, H.  I guess you select these depending on the size of lead you end up putting in it.I bought the green, it is quite dark which is great - could be describes as a forest green?I liked it so much I ended up buying a 600 pen to go with it.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 July 2021

title: The best mechanical pencil
review: Perhaps the best mechanical pencil available on the market, writing with the 600 0.5mm has been a pleasure and has made me enjoy writing again. The weight of the pencil seems heavy at first, but I'd say it's a good type of heavy. They're smaller in length compared to standard plastic mechanical pencils, but feel perfect in the hand. Additionally, the grip is very satisfying to hold and isn't too rough on the fingers.Overall, this is a great mechanical pencil. A definite step up from the 500. The weight isn't a problem, as some reviewers may mention. You'll actually prefer it being this heavy, trust me.

prod_name: Derwent34214 Graphic Medium Graphite Drawing Pencils, Set of 12, Professional Quality, Black
title: Derwents are some of the best around
reviewer: Mz Nina, business consultant and aspiring artist
review: I looove this brand, also all their colored pencil lines.  I know everyone is Prismacolor crazy, but it is hype.  Derwents are just as good and I am a little partial to them simply they are the ones I learn to draw with even as a kid.  I remember my first Derwent kit that Dad bought me, 120 pencils and I was around 8 and we were livi9ng in Australia.I love the water color pencils, the graphite, the ink tense that you can actually draw on fabric with and it stays, and the color soft line.  I also have a few others, but those are my favorites.I would say there pencils are as good as any other including Prismacolor.Just make sure to get the right pencil sharpener no matter what you use.  Get a Derwent battery operated, which is still made or a Panasonic or a used HUNT-Boston, all of which are no longer made.  DO NOT GET X-ACTO, it chews your pencils up and constantly breaks the lead.INFO ON ELECTRIC PENCIL SHARPENERS:I am a color pencil artist, and you need to have either a Panasonic, "Hunt-Boston" pencil sharpener, otherwise your colored pencils are eaten.  NEVER BUY X-ACTO for colored pencils, X-ACTO will eat your pencils.  Until you can find a Panasonic or Hunt-Boston, or Hunt or Boston electric pencil sharpener, get this if you can find one, or the Derwent "BLACK" model as it had 2 holes, one for a longer tip and one for a shorter tip.  I have both.  I had bought the Derwent one as I have Derwent but also use Prismacolor and graphite.  Panasonic and Hunt Boston are NO LONGER MADE no matter WHAT anyone says.  I was lucky to buy a new PANASONIC electric pencil sharpener by trolling the net until I found on.  Bought a used Boston, model #18, used on eBay and paid waaaay too much.  It was pretty beaten up.Also, if you do buy used, get one in the best quality that you can and just pay the extra, I would say up to $35.  I personally would not spend more than that.  I paid $38 for my new Panasonic.Also, X-ACTO bought out "Hunt-Boston" and all new models are a 4 digit model number, the actual "Hunt-Boston" is only a 2 digit.  This issue is that X-ACTO still sells under the Hunt Boston name, and it is misleading as it now uses X-ACTO cutters, which do NOTHING but EAT your pencils.  I also do not like it when someone lies about what they are selling.I bought what I thought was a "HUNT" electric pencil sharpener, it came in a box that had the Hunt name and packaging, but when I opened it up it was a, you guessed right...  An X-ACTO!!  Said so right on the sharpener.Bought on line here at Amazon from Overstock.com, but I returned it and got a refund, including shipping as they were misleading.Hope this helps with those of you who are colored pencil artist.  Get a PANASONIC, HUNT-BOSTON or Derwent sharpener.Also, run a graphite pencil through your sharpener first thing every day and it will stay sharp longer since colored pencils are waxy and tend to build up on the cutters.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 18 February 2013

prod_name: Derwent34214 Graphic Medium Graphite Drawing Pencils, Set of 12, Professional Quality, Black
title: 9h softer than 8h, otherwise perfect pencils.
review: So I did swatches of all the pencils I received (bought 12 hard and 12 soft sets) and was surprised at how dark 9h looked. I then start a swatch with 8h and it was much lighter. I thought maybe I just pressed lighter on the 8h, I continued with the rest of the pencils, and everything was perfect. So I did more comparisons of 8h and 9h with drawing lines, different shading, etc, and 9h is definitely darker than 8h, but whatever, I at least now know what to expect from both those pencils, probably just a lull in quality assurance that day. So a star off for that, butt other than that, great pencils, will buy again for their great price and (hopefully more reliable) quality.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 17 December 2015

So I'm not gonna risk it). Great product.

title: Used the brand before got what I wanted at half the price of hobby lobby
review: I have used these pencils before and I like them. My only gripe is that retail store sell them for more than Amazon does by almost $10-$20 more depending on the pencil count. This is the first tin I have gotten that has a damaged pencil in see photo it doesn‚Äôt look like it ruined the core of the pencil thankfully. For some of the reviews that mention only getting them in a tin without a lid and just the bottom shrink wrapped(the only difference is the lid not being there it‚Äôs still only the bottom shrink wrapped even if you get a lid not sure why they do that.) I would blame Derwent for that more than Amazon as even retail stores like hobby lobby get tins like that.

title: Derwent sketch pencils
review: I took up drawing about 2 years ago and have taught myself by watching self help videos on YouTube and up until recently I've been using cheap pencils and getting varried results sometimes struggling with my shading until I bought these now I wouldn't profess to be an artist but the results are far better much smoother when shading I'm very impressed I would definitely recommend to buy these

title: Great brand, highly recommend!
review: Gave these as a gift, my husband loved them. Very easy to use for beginners/novice artist. Pencils make clear/clean lines, they don't smear easily, and the eraser that comes with it works great.

prod_name: Derwent34214 Graphic Medium Graphite Drawing Pencils, Set of 12, Professional Quality, Black
title: Great Starter Range Pencils
review: I love the quality of these pencils. I am taking a drawing class for the first time this semester and the range these pencils give me is great. I've had my teacher tell several other students that their supplies weren't adequate but has always just focused on showing me how to use mine. I don't know too much about pencils but if you're looking for a great starter range I would recommend this set.The only down side I have for the pencils is that the case doesn't allow for easy viewing and the pencils fall out fairly easily. However, I didn't really consider the case a huge deal because it stores them perfectly in transit. I just think it would be nice if the pencils snapped in and had a label along the bottom (not on the pencil) to know which pencil you're grabbing (because the pencils will rotate in the case).
date: Reviewed in the United States on 4 November 2013

prod_name: Derwent34214 Graphic Medium Graphite Drawing Pencils, Set of 12, Professional Quality, Black
title: Great quality, great condition
review: This product only took a day to deliver. I also live in Canada, so that might be different for others. The graphite is pretty resistant to breaking, lays down graphite smoothly, and is pretty dark. It's not the darkest or smoothest I've drawn with, but it is super affordable. The overall quality of the pencils are still very good, artist quality. They're great for quick sketches, but excel in detailed sketches.

title: I've used better
review: This works all right, though the retraction of the extending lead shield is not as easy as some I have used. I expected the shield to retract as the lead wears down, but it does not appear to do so. Although it is too wide to fit my pencil-holders, I will continue to use my Faber-Castell Grip Plus 0.7 pencil, which is greatly superior.

title: Great Faber-Castell leads once one of the mechanical issue was sorted out.
review: Pack of three Mechanical pencils. The 0.7 and 0.5 work fine. The 0.35 was problematic. The lead (graphite) inside constantly broke when pressing the top to reveal more of the 0.35 lead, and it intermittently slipped back into the barrel of the pencil when you finally get the lead to emerge and put it to paper. I Had to remove bits of the broken lead (and the other two leads inside the pencil), make sure no small lengths left inside, then very carefully insert a single 0.35 lead and started again. This problem seems to be solved - so far - now that there is only one 0.35 lead in the pencil. This is a mechanical issue, not the leads in the pencils. These are excellent and produce smooth and consistent marks on the paper used. In conclusion: Initial disappointment from usual excellent Faber-Castell products but will monitor and report back.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 26 April 2021

title: These are a must for any artist
review: Arteza never fails to give good quality products. Before I bought this product I was trying to find packs of professional drawing pencils that had great quality to them. I never seemed to LOVE the packs I'd buy until I bought this.This tin includes 12 professional grade pencils (6B to 4H). I love that all of these pencils come in a metal tin for safe keeping. My other pencils I would throw into the cup that holds my micron pens and primsacolor pencils and it took forever to find the size I needed for my drawing. This metal tin is super lightweight which makes travel so much easier and handy. There's a divot in the tin for each of the 12 pencils keeping them from breaking or getting damaged. The pencils come already sharpened. You can't beat the price for this type of quality which is why I trust Arteza products. They are all affordable and you get the same quality product that you would if you paid more for the expensive brands.If you're looking for professional sketching pencils look no farther. You will not be disappointed by this product.

title: Buena calidad
review: Los compr√© como sustitutos de los Prismacolor col-erase, muy caros y dif√≠ciles de conseguir en Espa√±a. El trazo no es tan suave ni con tanta textura, pero son buenos y para abocetar tampoco hace falta tener el mejor l√°piz del mundo. Los seguir√© utilizando y comprando.

prod_name: STAEDTLER 144 50NC24 Noris Club Erasable Colouring Pencils - Assorted Colours, Pack of 24
title: They really do erase!
review: Nice bright colours and they really do erase!I bought these for a strange reason. I teach piano and I am constantly copying off pages of music so I can highlight aspects in colour for students. I find this works much better for students than everything in black. However, I'm never sure that pupils should go into exams with books covered in coloured markings. After one pupil found it hard to play the piece when we switched from the colour page to the plain music, I thought it would be brilliant if you could rub out colours in the way you can pencil. And so I found these. They make good strong markings on the page as long as they are sharp. I can't comment on colouring in, I'm afraid, as I've only used them for writing in colour.I'm being brave now and writing over all sorts of things in colour on the assumption I can rub it out later. So far, so good!
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 July 2015

prod_name: STAEDTLER 144 50NC24 Noris Club Erasable Colouring Pencils - Assorted Colours, Pack of 24
title: Sehr gute Farbstifte, mein Sohn liebt sie
review: Zuerst habe ich den 12-er Set gekauft, aber mein Sohn hat seine beliebteste Farben in einen Monat genutzt. Also habe ich diesen set gekauft. Die Farben sind toll, das sie radierbar sind ist ein weiterer plus, weswegen ich sie auch gekauft habe.

prod_name: STAEDTLER 144 50NC24 Noris Club Erasable Colouring Pencils - Assorted Colours, Pack of 24
title: Lassen sich bei leichten Skizzen gut radieren
review: Die Staedtler Noris Club Farbstifte kommen in einer einfachen Pappschachtel in einem B√ºndel aus zw√∂lf Stiften daher. Der Clou an den Buntstiften ist, dass sie sich wie gew√∂hnliche Bleistifte wegradieren lassen sollen. Dementsprechend ist an jedem Stift ein wei√ües Radiergummi angebracht.Die Buntstifte haben eine gute Farbvielfalt und lassen sich angenehm auftragen. Ich nutze sie vor allen Dingen zum Skizzieren von Aquarellen oder Projekten mit Alkoholmarkern, da Buntstifte kein Graphit enthalten, was sich st√∂rend mit den Farben vermengen kann.Bei leichten Skizzen lassen sich die Stifte auch angenehm radieren. Eine leichte Farbt√∂nung ist dennoch zu sehen, vollst√§ndig bekommt man die Pigmente also nicht mehr vom Papier. Dies zeigt sich besonders, wenn man einmal ein wenig fester dr√ºckt: je mehr Pigment auf die Seiten kommt, desto mehr schmiert die Farbe und desto weniger wirkt das Radiergummi. Darauf sollten vor allen Dingen Menschen mit einem festeren Zeichenstil achten. F√ºr leichte Skizzen oder sanfte Schattierungen sind die Bundstifte aber auf jeden Fall geeignet.

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip 1345 0.5mm Mechanical Pencil - Green
title: After 4 months still working amazing.
review: I bought this pencil as a student in high school and honestly, it just blew me away. I love the feel and color of the pencil, as well as how amazingly it works. After a while, I really got used to the twist eraser and have found it useful so many times. However, the eraser refills from faber castell were way too expensive and I had trouble finding a cheaper replacement with the right thickness to fit in the holding container. However I did find one on amazon, the Factis BM-2 mechanical eraser refills give a lot more for cheaper, as long as you're willing to cut the erasers to the right length.It's an easy to disassemble pencil to diagnose any errors, something I had to do after dropping it a bunch after spinning it in class. Just remove the eraser casing by pulling it out (or else it will shoot out when you pull out the front part of the pencil) turn the grip counter clockwise until it's loose from the pencil until it's loose, then just pull. I am also really satisfied with the pencil grip, however it has gotten a little loose (not loose enough to feel any difference when writing, it just makes it a little hard when you're turning it to disassemble it) so it get's harder to disassemble the pencil (although you'd rarely do that, but that's why 4 stars) and you can fix it by adding a little glue or adhesive to the grip, which is also removeable. All in all really good pencil that's served a grade 12 High School student well, just keep in mind that you'll have to buy specialized eraser refills that are a little difficult to find.

title: Pencils
review: Hard to find 2B pencils. These are predictable in quality, which is good. Maybe the eraser is just wee bit too soft, or maybe I just press a little too hard when using it. I have ordered these before, and used them, and will order more when this supply has been exhausted.  Update: I have recently had to buy other makes of 2B pencil and I can state that none have been anywhere near as good as these by Oxford.  Even more expensive pencils are nowhere near as a good.  I have been given, as presents, some very highly regarded and very expensive types of pencils which have allegedly been used by high profile and famous writers and authors and these Oxford pencils beat them all, in my opinion.  For quality and price, they can‚Äôt be beaten.

A sign on the door instructs to place parcel on the porch chair please. Thrown on the doormat. Not hygienic or good for the elderly having to bend down. I knew a delivery driver who could not read English well. Again ‚ÄúWHY‚Äù - ‚Äúaren‚Äôt they TAUGHT COMMON INSTRUCTIONS?‚Äù We would be if we worked abroad, it is the rule in many places. title: good quality but uncomfortable
review: It writes quite smoothly unlike some mechanical pencils that gives annoying scratching noise as I write on paper. But the thing that I personally did not like was that there is no soft wrap around the place where people hold, it is just hard plastic, which leaves red marks on my fingers if I use them for too long. And the little rubber at the back does nothing but messes everything up.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 January 2024
